loans.name: Javier

texts.en: Javier works at a workshop. He is a single man and he has no children. Javier lives in La Paz and he needs a loan to find another place to live and pay a deposit known as "anticretico". Javier needs help because he is alone but he is healthy and he wants to improve his life quality. He is sure he will find a good place.

loans.use: to find another place to live and pay a deposit known as "anticretico"

loans.name: Mujeres En El Sendero De Dios 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ildalina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres En El Sendero de Dios 1 & 4 (Women in the path of God). Her group is located in the city of Puerto Plata, an area famous for its tourist places and natural resources. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her only child and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge was to overcome the death of her father. In the meantime, she likes to watch television and share with her child.

Ildalina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She started her business with her savings almost two years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for women and men, and also to buy underwear. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business, and to provide for the needs of her family.

Ildalina dreams of having her own house and her business local. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear, and women's and men's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives in Madaba. Her husband works in public works. Ghada wants to be a productive woman and help her husband with the household expenses. She started to learn how to do mosaics, and she is a talented woman. She began to make mosaics and sells by special order. Ghada is applying for a loan to buy tools and wood borders to increase her products. This will help her to improve her standard of living and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy tools and wood borders for her mosaics

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 49, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has been a construction worker for five years, and earns, on average, USD 10.00 a day. She is married to Ngan, 49, also a construction worker, and they have five children.

Sokha wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family and so has requested a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Sokha is thankful for this loan opportunity provided through HKL, which offers a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem, 47, lives in a small community in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is a construction worker and earns, on average, $8.00 US a day. So far, she has been in this career for 25 years. She is married to Phun, 49, employed as a construction worker too. This couple has five children.

Tem wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking out a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai’s family has continued to grow over the past year! She and her husband recently had another baby and they are excited about the positive changes in their lives. With their previous Kiva loan, their earnings from hammock weaving and their increased financial knowledge through the Kiva program, they were able to purchase a motorcycle! They repaid their last loan in full before the baby arrived and now busy mom Mai feels like it is more important than ever to be able to depend on her weaving income. This year, she is taking on a larger loan in order to help them leap ahead financially and provide for their larger family.

loans.use: increase her hammock production to have more financial security and savings.

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: 32-year-old Oeun is living in a rural village of Sambour district of Kratie province. She is married with two children. One of the children is in primary school while the other one is in secondary school. To support the family, Oeun has been managing a small grocery store at home for the last 14 years. She manages to save around 5 USD per day. This is her first time being a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 riels each. Her purpose for the loan is to buy stock for her grocery store. She wishes for her business to keep expanding so that they can earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Marko

texts.en:
Marko, age 37, is a married man and has a two-year-old son. Currently, he is an agriculturalist. Marko dropped out of school at the secondary level, so he was determined to work hard so that his children could study in university.

Marko started working in the cultivation of cassava. His uncle taught him this activity. Currently, he cultivates a hectare of cassava and also raises cattle. He buys baby cows and, after about six months, he sells them.

The money from this loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and insecticide, as well as to pay for the preparation of the land.

His dream is to be able to have an excellent harvest and, with the profits, begin to build the house that he has wanted so much.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new fridge for the house to save the food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a wall around the yard of his house.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
As a widow, Mang has been excited to establish her independence through her weaving work, her Kiva loan, and her financial training. Over the past year she has been able to make a number of changes in her life and try new things, including a higher rate of weaving work. She has experimented to find the perfect amount of weaving to take on and built a perfect balance. 

She used her last loan simply to cover daily expenses and a few unexpected bills, but this year she is taking a loan to help her grow and save.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is part of a new generation within her community – she is a young woman fighting to build a brighter future. Many people in her village are still trying to eke out a living in slash and burn corn farming, but Kanika is committed to building long-term prosperity as a weaver. 

She took a gamble on becoming a full-time weaver in 2014, and has focused all of her energy on building her hammock operation. The price of corn has continued to drop this year, making Kanika feel proud of her decision to take a new path. 

In 2015 she is taking out a new Kiva loan and taking more steps toward a better future.

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.en:
Bahrigul was born in the year 1993. She is a careful mother of two children. Bahrigul’s children are little. She lives with her family in a South Tajikistan. She is a hardworking woman and she works hard from early morning until late evening every day. 

Bahrigul has been busy with animal husbandry for more than two years. She mainly feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products in a local market. Her husband helps her with feeding cows. Bahrigul is going to increase the working capital and in this way get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 800 USD to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en: Roziya is widowed. She was born in the year 1953. She is a careful mother of six children. She is a hardworking person and she has been busy with business. Roziya sells clothes in a local market. She sells women’s and children’s clothes, and she has a selling place in a local market. She tries to sell seasonal clothes, and so she renews the assortment of goods periodically. Her son helps her with managing business. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy clothes for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.en:
Haitgul was born in 1963 year. She is married and has five children. She began her business five years ago thanks to IMON.  Now, she successfully runs her business. Haitgul works hard to earn a living and she tries to offer high quality living conditions for her children. 

She has 3-hectare land where she grows wheat and corn. She also grows watermelon. Haitgul’s children help her to grow agriculture products. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers.

loans.name: Ma. Salve

texts.en:
Her name is Ma.Salve, 38, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Silverio, her business partner, and she is a mother to her two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their daily needs and support the education of their children.

Ma.Salve operates an upholstery business. She provides furniture and vehicle seats with padding, springs, webbing, and fabric or leather covers. She earns a minimum of Php 700 in profit every day. Her customers are her neighbors, the people in the community and the passerby from other communities.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan to buy materials like fabric, padding, foam, and other materials needed in her business. She is encouraged by the positive feedback on her work. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs and the schooling of her children.

Ma.Salve dreams to have another branch, and aims to send her children to good schools. She prays for a happy and godly life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week; she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabrics, padding and springs  needed for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano lives with her family in the south part of Tajikistan. She is married and has four children. Rano is a very industrious woman, and she has been busy with animal husbandry more than one year. Rano buys cattle, feed some months, and sells in a local market. She has a big garden where she grows feed for the cattle. She manages the business alone and so she works hard every day. 

She is going to increase her working capital and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Her name is Charita, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.   She is married to Gregorio, a tricycle driver, and they have five children. One is in college, two are in high school and two in elementary school. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income, to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Charita operates a tricycle, and has a small general store. Her husband drives the tricycle, which carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation.   Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes  to market, to church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even travel from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an PHP 11,000 loan, which she will use for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle  She is positive that this will boost her income, as tricycle transportation is a necessity in their area. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely fund their daily needs and cover her children's education.

Charita dreams of owning more tricycle units someday, and prays for the safety of her husband and his passengers. She aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, alegre, feliz, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Nueva Tilata’  que se caracteriza por abastecer con 32 pozos de agua subterránea a la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura ambiente entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Miriam es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo  que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio de la familia construido de ladrillo y adobe con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; bistec (carne con arroz y papas), sajta de pollo (pollo picante, con chuño), pollo al horno y lechón al horno. Ella se ocupa de cocinar en su casa por las noches para dejarlo todo listo y cocinado al día siguiente, se moviliza en un carrito de dos ruedas con una garrafa de gas, recorre ferias, calles y comercios hasta terminar su comida, recorrido que realiza en 3 horas antes de que se acabe toda la comida. “empecé ayudando a mi mamá luego llegó mi bebe y me independicé…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un refrigerador e insumos de cocina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador e insumos de cocina para vender comida y satisfacer las necesidades de su bebé.
texts.en:
Miriam, 21, is single and has a daughter, 3.  Her business is selling traditional food.  She's an enterprising, happy, responsible, and hardworking young woman.  She works in the Nueva Tilata area, known for supplying the city with water from 32 underground wells.  The climate is cold and dry, with temperatures between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Miriam is short and dark and of robust build, and she wears her long black hair tied back in a pony tail.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish because of her business.  She lives with her child, who is not yet of school age, in their own room in a family home built of brick and adobe with a corrugated metal roof; they have potable water, electricity, gas, and a sewer system.

Her business is selling traditional food like steak with rice and potatoes, "sajta" (spicy chicken with chuño [dehydrated potato]), roast chicken, and roast pork.  She cooks at home at night to have everything prepared for the next day.  She goes around in a little two-wheeled cart with a cylinder of gas to street fairs, streets, and businesses until her food runs out, a trip that takes three hours.  "I started helping my mother, then I went out on my own when my baby was born," she said.  Her dream is to open a restaurant.

Miriam is requesting a loan to invest in her business with the purchase of a refrigerator and cooking supplies to sell food and fulfill her baby's needs.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the six years she has been in this business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and cooking supplies to sell food and fulfill her baby's needs

loans.name: Oysuluv

texts.en:
Oysuluv was born in 1972. She is a careful mother of five children. The only family income is from the agriculture business. She has been busy with growing vegetables and crops. She has 2 hectare (ha) of land. She grows wheat in a 1 ha and onion in a 1 ha. Additionally, she keeps cattle for further selling. 

Oysuluv likes her job, and she is grateful to her land because it is her feed keeper. She is going to make new sowing, but she does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 500 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a stock of mineral water needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more gallons of mineral water, which she sells at retail. Aside from her water distribution, she also sells rice and electronic load. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, and for a good return on her investments, for it will surely help fund her family's everyday needs. 

Jinky dreams for her businesses to flourish and grow. She prays for a healthy and a godly living. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of mineral water to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn is thankful that she was granted an 18,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to support her needs, help her aging parents and support her child's schooling. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus, increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund her family's daily needs and pay for the schooling of her only child. 

Katlyn dreams of having a bigger general store someday to improve their quality of living. She aims to send her child to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his shop and buy new tools to help him improve the quality

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Her name is Erlinda. She is 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, and married to Wilfredo, a driver. They have two children. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal household needs.

Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, Erlinda is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, oil and beverages. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. A good return on her investment will surely help fund their basic needs.

Erlinda hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 27, is from a rural village located in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province. She is married with one child. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, and they have been in this business for seven years. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day. This is Mom’s third loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more from crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en: Bai revels in the economic freedom that weaving has brought into her life. Before weaving, she had very limited opportunities - but as a weaver she earns a healthy income and has autonomy. She has the highest quality control standards for her work, which makes her a very popular weaving teammate. Bai has also really enjoyed the financial training she’s undertaken as part of the Kiva program. As a grandmother, Bai is looking out for the wellbeing of several generations. She puts her money into the family pool to ensure that everyone can stay healthy and well-nourished.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Banyen

texts.en: Banyen has fully committed to hammock weaving for her income- last year she took out a loan through the Kiva program and did not plant any corn, which is a major revolution within her community. For Banyen, this was a lucky year to make the shift. The price of corn has continued to drop, but she was able to maintain stability and repay her Kiva loan by focusing on weaving work. As a younger member of the weaving community, she is looking forward to continuing to build her income and advance her skills. This year she is taking the next step with another loan that will help her build more financial security.

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Andrea Margarita

texts.es:
Andrea joven de 22 años de edad,simpática, soltera reside actualmente con sus tíos paternos que han estado a cargo de ella en representación de sus padres quienes por motivos laborales tuvieron que trasladarse a otra ciudad de este país, dando así a la joven la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios universitarios.
Actualmente estudia la carrera de diseño de interiores en una de las universidades mas reconocidas para formar a los mejores estudiantes en el ámbito artístico.
Se considera una joven responsable y dedicada a sus estudios, le agrada ser una persona solidaria con quienes necesiten de su apoyo, es creativa y detallista entrega sus trabajos a tiempo y con excelente presentación.
Su motivación es poder superarse profesionalmente, le gusta su profesión y ama lo que hace,eso le motiva a seguir aprendiendo y explorar mas acerca del diseño, para poder cumplir las necesidades de las personas que ocupen de su ayuda en el área de diseño,también considera que su carrera es un medio de apoyo económico para su familia ya que será la principal fuente de empleo en el futuro.
Desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país, mediante la aplicación de sus conocimientos de diseñadora ya que hoy en día el género femenino se ve limitado para desempeñar un puesto de trabajo en una empresa u organización, ella desea transmitir el mensaje a la sociedad que las mujeres tienen el potencial de poder realizar proyectos que pueden beneficiar a la sociedad.
Su lección de vida la ha adquirido mediante su carrera universitaria, ya que al momento de realizar su segunda practica profesional, en un centro de diseño único en su país, pudo conocer mas acerca de todo lo que relaciona a su carrera con el ambiente laboral. 
Sus planes son poder encontrar un empleo en el área de diseño de interiores y poder prepararse mediante una maestría en administración de empresas que le permitan construir las bases para formar su propia empresa en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Andrea is a young woman of 22 years. She has a nice disposition, is unmarried and resides at present with her paternal aunt and uncle who have been taking care of her in place of her parents, who have moved to another city in the country for work, leaving her here where she can finish her university studies.

At present, she majoring in interior design in one of the universities that is best known for preparing students in the artistic field.  Andrea is considered a responsible young woman, dedicated to her studies; she enjoys supporting others who need her help. She is creative and detail-oriented, turns her work in on time and with excellent presentation. 

Her desire is to be able to achieve great things professionally. She likes her profession and loves what she does. This motivates her to keep learning and to explore the field of design more closely, to be able to fulfill the needs of the people who want her help in the area of design. She also considers her career a means of economic support for her family, since she will be the principal source of employment in the future.

She wants to contribute to the development of her country through the apllication of her knowledge of design, since today women are limited in the performance of positions in a company or organization. She wants to send the message to society that women have the potential to be able to carry out projects that can benefit society.

Andrea has acquired her life lesson through her university program. At present she is doing her second professional internship in a unique design center in her country. She has been able to get to know up close everything related to her field in the working world. Her plans are to be able to find employment in the area of interior design and to prepare herself with a master’s degree in business administration to construct the base upon which to form her own company in a not-too-distant future.

loans.use: to complete her university studies in the area of interior design.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José es un joven de 29 años, se encuentra laborando desde hace 4 años motivo por el cual inicio sus estudios universitarios, actualmente vive con su tío, tiene a su hermana y a su madre quien a sus 62 años de edad aún realiza 
trabajos en casa como forma de generar un ingreso para su familia; el joven hace algunos años sufrió la perdida de su padre por lo que se vio en la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingreso y con esto colaborar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Sus cualidades mas destacadas son la honradez, la responsabilidad y el respeto a los demás, ya que desde pequeño sus padres le inculcaron siempre lo mejor de ellos como ejemplo.

Su motivación inicial es la superación personal, mediante su finalización de estudios universitarios los cuales ha establecido como prioridad ya que sabe que logrando profesionalizarse mejoraran sus oportunidades de empleo.

Desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país mediante sus practicas de negocios y conocimientos de marketing en negociaciones con países internacionales que generen fuentes de empleo creando oportunidades para los miles de compatriotas que se encuentran en la búsqueda de una fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
José is a young man of 29 years, who finds himself working for the past 4 years since the beginning of his university studies.  He currently lives with his uncle, and has a sister and a mother, who at her 62 years of age still does housework as a way of generating income for her family.  Some years ago, he suffered the loss of his father and because of this saw the necessity of finding a source of income.  With this he was able to contribute to sustaining his family.

His most defining qualities are honesty, responsibility, and respect for others.  Since he was young his parents always instilled in him the best of themselves as example.  His current motivation is personal improvement, and by completing his university studies, which he has made a priority, he knows that he will increase his professional employment opportunities.

He wishes to contribute to the development of his country through his business practices, and his understanding of marketing and negotiation with the international community that generate means of employment and create opportunities for his thousands of countrymen who find themselves searching for a source of income.

loans.use: to complete his university education in International Business and Marketing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of European Studies. Here is his story:

“My life is like a drama movie, a lot of changes in it and touching my heart events. I am 19 years old. At the age of 5 my parents were divorced. My mother decided to take care of me. Not long after, she married another man and we moved to Kuwait. I stayed with them, went to the Russian Federation Embassy’s school as I didn’t know the Arabic language and couldn’t study at the local schools. It was hard to get accustomed to the new society, new culture, and new family.

Time passed and my mother gave a birth to other three children, and my step-father built their own house. After I had finished the school and was 18 years-old, my step-father refused to take care of me anymore. My mother couldn’t do anything as she had her family and other three children, so I moved back to Kyrgyzstan to my father. Several months ago my father underwent a kidney transplantation and unfortunately, now he is a disabled person. I am willing to help my father and further going to stay with him.

The most important thing for me now is getting a high education. I know that I am the only person who should act now, in order to be able to live and be happy. A good education guarantees a well-paid job, a positive image of me in the society, and enables me to support my father now, and my family in the future.   I await your support and in advance thank you for your generosity.”

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition in order to be able to support his sick father

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.en:
Kumriniso is a communicative person. She was born in 1976. She is living in a remote district, and she is married and has three children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation as an emigrant. It is hard for her to keep her family. She does a business of keeping cattle and planting agricultural products. 

Kumriniso has a little yard where she plants her agricultural products, but she gets a small harvest from it. The income from her business is not enough to cover family expenditures. She wants to improve her standard of living. She is planning to buy seeds and corn for planting and gaining new harvest. She is hoping for financial support from Kiva project. Kumriniso awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and corn for planting.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and he has one child. He describes himself to be open-minded. He operates carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favorable place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock of timber. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to establish a furniture shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his lifestyle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Asiypa

texts.ru: Асийпа, 48 лет, она замужем, есть 4 детей. Образование у Асийпы среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Асийпы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова и 20 овец. На участке мерою 1,9 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль.  Ежемесячный доход Асийпы составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Асийпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность достойно растить своих детей.
texts.en: Asiypa is 48, married and has four children. She has a secondary education and earns income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she began 29 years ago. Thanks to her hard work she currently has a cow and 20 sheep. She plants beans on a 1.9 hectare plot of land and earns around 25,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her business, Asiypa applied for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 15 sheep to fatten and resell. She plans to use the profits to invest in growing her business in order to raise her children with dignity.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Poline

texts.en: Poline is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 19 years old. She describes herself as outgoing. She operates a farm, where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a profitable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate changes. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to increase production within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a married man. He has seven children ranging from four years to 20 years old. He describes himself as open minded. 

He operates a retail business where he sells groundnuts. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a favourable place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of groundnuts. His business goal is to be a large scale distributor within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of groundnuts.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man who has three children. He describes himself to be outgoing. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to expand to a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his lifestyle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, sugar, bread, flour, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt and other items. Her business goal is to set up a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve herself.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Kue

texts.en: Kue’s participation in the Kiva loan program in 2014 enabled her to save up a small chunk of money for the first time! Over the past year, she has been able to contribute meaningfully to her family, pay off her loan and establish a savings account. This level of stability and progress is very meaningful for Kue. And in a very exciting development, she was recently able to take a small vacation to see one of her married daughters who lives in a different community. For Kue, weaving and her Kiva loan have made a permanent difference in her life and she looks forward to making more progress in 2015.

loans.use: to jumpstart her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun is 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband in a rural area located in the Kos Krolo district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, and she has been in this business for 18 years. The current business earns her family about 38,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is the sixth loan for Sokun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earns her more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador de 44 años de edad, no fue a la escuela por ser de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven en el mismo terreno pero son independientes. 

Salvador trabaja en la agricultura, siembra maíz y sorgo, desde niño fue lo que le inculcó su padre al no tener posibilidad de estudiar, también cuida de ganado bovino de doble propósito junto con uno de sus hijos que vive cerca.

El crédito lo necesita para reparar las cercas de su terreno y alquilar máquina para picar el zacate para alimentar al ganado. 

A futuro desea tener animales de mayor producción y tener mejores instalaciones en su casa para la época de lluvia.
texts.en:
Salvador is 44 years old.  He did not go to school due to scarce economic resources.  He is in a relationship and his partner works at maintaining the home.  He has 5 children, of whom only two live on the same property, but they are independent.

Salvador has worked in the farming of corn and sorghum since he was a child. It is what his father taught him since there was no possibility of him going to school.  He also cares for dual-purpose bovine together with one of his children who lives nearby.

He needs the loan he is asking for to repair the fencing on his land and to rent a machine to cut the hay to feed the livestock.

In the future he wants to have animals with greater production and to improve his house for the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair the fencing on his land and to rent a machine to cut the hay to feed the livestock

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime describes himself as a hardworking, honest person who likes to read, listen to music and spend time with his family. He is 39 years old and single. He started his beauty salon five years ago and has been doing very well. He says that the business has an excellent location. Jaime is asking for a loan to buy beauty products to be able to offer more services to his clients. His goal is to open another beauty salon and eventually own a chain with many locations.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for his beauty parlor.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia nuevamente solicita este crédito a FUSAI, en esta ocasión desea invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado  dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien busca las formas para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Expresa estar muy agradecida con el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Cecilia is once again requesting a loan from FUSAI. At this time she wants to invest in her business selling clothing and footwear as it is her main source of income. She is an enterprising woman who looks for ways to provide for her household. She says that she is very pleased with the help she has received in the past so she could improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman and she has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God-fearing and determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a place conducive to business, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transport.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This will enable her to have enough stock to sell; hence, increase her profits.

Her business goal is to have an expansive business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will complete her own house that she is building. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Moline

texts.en:
Moline is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt and other items. 

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will generate wealth and sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt and other items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be God-fearing.

He operates a car wash. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are car owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel for pumps.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a car wash pump and other items for the business.

His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a car wash pump and other items for his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells washing soap, salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are individuals. 

Alex will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, washing soap, and other items. His business goal is to expand the shop within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a reliable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail shop where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are hotels and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Rose will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to serve a large market within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. 

He hopes that in the future he will increase his stock. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be kind and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have a larger clothing store within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have a larger clothing store within five years. She hopes that in the future she will generate wealth and sustain her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a viable location, and his primary customers are the general public. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future he will succeed in business. This is his third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Cesar Anibal

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 23 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja  se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija de 8 meses de edad y además vive con él su mamá. 

Cesar se dedica a trabajos de agricultura desde hace 5 años, trabaja  también como empleado en una hacienda de la comunidad, su compañera de vida administra una pequeña tienda y él le ayuda siempre que puede.

Él utilizará el préstamo como complemento para construir su casa, ya que por el momento no tiene casa propia, pero con el crédito solventará una parte de esos gastos.

Su sueño es tener una tienda mas fuerte y planea ampliarla mas adelante y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young 23-year-old man, and only studied until the second grade.  He is in a relationship and his partner tends to the home.  He has an 8-month-old daughter and his mother also lives with him.

Cesar has worked in agriculture for the past 5 years, and also works as an employee on an estate in the community.  His life partner runs a small store and he always helps her when he can.

He will use the loan to pay part of the costs to build his home, since he does not currently have his own house.  With the loan he will be able to cover part of the expenses.

His dreams are to have a better store (which he plans to expand in the future), and to finish building his home.

loans.use: to build his house, since he does not currently have his own home; with the loan he will be able to cover part of the expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable location. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Gavharoi

texts.en:
Gavharoi is conscientious woman. She was born in 1967. She is living in a rural area. She is divorced. She has two children. 

Gulsunoi is a hardworking, gentle and strong person. She has done business for about fifteen years. She keeps livestock. She is trading honored cattle in the domestic market. Her sons are helping her to do business. 

Gulsunoi is requested 7,000 TJS loan to buy honored cattle for further keeping and selling.

loans.use: to buy honored cattle.

loans.name: Gulby

texts.en:
Gulby was born in 1971. She is married. Gulby lives with her family in a village. She has been busy with growing wheat and vegetables. She has worked in this field for some years and knows her deal well. 

Gulby works hard every day. She also is a nurse and works in a local hospital. She is very hardworking woman. 

Gulby plans to sow potatoes, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She hopes that Kiva lenders will not reject her request, and she awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be active.

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishable products.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man. He has four children. He describes himself to be capable.

He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

His business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is that she will have a large fashion shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde y siembra de granos básicos, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 3 dependen de ella. 

Lidia se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce en una pequeña panadería que han construido junto con su esposo desde hace 4 años, negocio que hasta la fecha les ha ido muy bien, antes de hacer pan ella solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda y para comprar insumos para la panadería.

Ella espera en un futuro ayudar a su esposo con una granja de pollos que recién ha iniciado y cree que con las ganancias de la panadería podrá invertir en ese nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Lidia, 49, studied until her 3rd year of secondary school. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are dependent. Her husband makes a living breeding broiler chickens and planting basic grains. 

Lidia makes pastries in a small bakery that she built with her husband 4 years ago and business has been doing well so far. Before this, she only tended to her household duties. 

Lidia will use this loan to buy materials to improve her home and to buy supplies for the bakery. She hopes one day to help her husband with a chicken farm that he has just began working on and she believes that she could invest the profits from the bakery in this new project.

loans.use: to buy materials to make house improvements and to buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Naranjillo Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 45 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 21, 19, 15, 9 y 6 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan.
Ella es buena madre, amable, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de repartir esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Martha es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa rosada). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como mensajero y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian una carrera técnica y estudian y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Sus deseos de superación por el bien de su familia la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de bisutería, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cuñapés, tienda de barrio, salteñería, venta de ollas y ferretería, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan tradicional como; pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca), Pan dulce (se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar), Rosca de maíz (a base de maíz), Tortilla (Es la masa de pan, que primeramente se aplana, se espolvorea con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre), y otros. “comencé con un horno industrial y algunas latas, mis hijos me ayudan en todo momento y también se encargan de la venta…” comenta. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de variedades de harina como; harina de maíz, de arroz, levadura y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración de variedades de pan. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harina y algún día cumplir su sueño de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is a 45 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 5 children aged 21, 19, 15, 9 and 6. Her business is making and selling bread. She is a good mother, friendly, independent, responsible and hard-working.

Her business is located in a place called ‘El Torno’ a rural area where producer/farmers of meat, milk, vegetables and grains are clustered together as well as commercial wholesalers and distributors who are in charge of the distribution of these products in the different markets of the city. It has a hot tropical, very humid climate with a temperature of 30 degrees during the whole year.

Martha is dark-skinned, low in stature, long black hair that she wears in a pony tail, dark eyes and robust build. Her native language is Guaraní which she uses in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for the business she does. (she is standing, the first from the left,wearing a pink blouse).

She shares her life with her partner who works as a messenger and her children. The two oldest are studying a technical course and the two youngest study at school. They live in their own house made of brick with a metal roof. They have well water and electricity. Her desire to excel with her family led her to head a communal bank of people with businesses like: selling jewellery, selling cosmetics by catalog, second hand clothing sales, the sales of cheese bread, a pottery store, the sale of pastries, selling pots and hardware to request a loan and achieve her goals.

Her business is making and selling traditional bread like; rice bread (from rice flour) Mollete (common bread of flour, granulated sugar and lard) sweet bread (using raisins, eggs, milk and sugar), Corn rosca (made from corn). tortilla (bread dough that is flattened and dusted with sugar and flour, doubled over and repeated several times, obtaining after cooking it a type of puff pastry) and others.

"I started with an industrial oven and some cans. My children always help me and also take care of the sales", she commented. Her dream is to see her children become professionals. She wants to invest in her business by buying a variety of flours like, rice and wheat flour, yeast and other ingredients needed to make her breads. This is her first loan with the institution in the 4 years she has done this business independently. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of flours and one day see her dream of her children as professionals fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy a variety of flours and one day see her dream of her children becoming professionals fulfilled.

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is a 26-year-old hardworking agriculturalist as well as a businessman who does public transport. He is a married man with two children; one child is four years old and the other is half a year old. He works for 11 hours a day, 6 days a week, saving the last day for God at church. He has another side income from cattle trade and rearing where he sells milk and other cattle products to the surrounding community. 

He started the transport business in 2013 in Ishaka Bushenyi where he does the business and on highways transporting people who are his clients. He started this business to earn an income. This is his first loan from the institution and he is borrowing this money to buy a motor vehicle to increase the income of his transport business. He hopes to educate his children into vital people in society. Most of his clients are passengers who love his way of doing business. Competition from his other transport businessmen is his main challenge. He asks the almighty to bless the Kiva lenders and Ugafode Microfinance and asks it to always be there for the needy but active people like him.

loans.use: To buy a motor vehicle

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está soltero por lo tanto nadie depende de él. 

José se dedica a trabajos de agricultura desde muy pequeño, él siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol, también compra ganado para criarlo y venderlo después a un precio mayor. 

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar una vaca ya que debido al cultivo de maíz le ha sobrado zacate y desea aprovecharlo para alimento de ganado. 

En un futuro él planea seguir trabajando sus tierras ya que es una labor que e él le gusta hacer.
texts.en:
Jose is 51 years of age and studied up to the fifth grade. He is single and, consequently, no one depends on him.

Jose has worked in agriculture since he was quite small. He sows basic grains such as corn and beans on his land. He also buys cattle to raise and sell later at a better price.

This loan will be utilized to purchase a cow, owing to the fact that his corn crop has produced a surplus which he has in storage and he wants to take advantage of this surplus to feed more cattle. 

In the future, Jose plans to continue working his land because this is labor he enjoys performing.

loans.use: buy a cow since he has stored his excess corn production and wishes to use this as cattle feed.

loans.name: Nyabange Grp Msm Group

texts.en:
Thomas, who is in his late 40s is married with four children; three sons and one daughter, and all of them are still in school.  He has been a food vendor for 20 years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Thomas' third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the food stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase the food stock and serve more people.  He dreams of owning a retail shop.

Thomas will share this loan with his loan group, Nyabange Grp Msm Group, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the food stock and serve more people

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 39 years old and from Rwenjonjo lc1, kakoni, kyamuhunga igara Bushenyi and this is where his business is located. He is a principle farmer mainly tea farming and banana plantation. Mr. Evan has no side income to raise some other income. He has seven children aged 19, 16, 13, 9, 6, 5 and 3. The four are all school-goers but he has managed to pay school fees for them and to look after the family. 

It is his eighth cycle with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) and he borrowed 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer for his plantations. He works eight hours a day and most of his clients are tea factories in and around Bushenyi District. He started that business eight years ago and for all those years, it has been very profitable. He resorted to tea farming after getting a chunk of land from his father as his share. He hopes to buy a car for transporting his outputs of tea leaves and others and later use the money to purchase another piece of land for an extension. He finds challenges of dry weather and price fluctuations.  He thanks UGAFODE so much for the support financially.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for her husband's shop

loans.name: Tania Del Carmen

texts.es:
La buena comida dicen que se anuncia por sentirse desde la cocina, y dar sazón a los alimentos es un trabajo que Tania, una joven de 26 años, hace bien desde hace dos años. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y esta es la forma como lucha por sacar adelante a su hijo. 
Tania solicita el crédito debido a que tiene deseos de comprar productos que utiliza como ingredientes en su comida: arroz, carnes, verduras, etc. con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Sus metas son seguir con su negocio y construirlo más para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo.
texts.en: They say that good food advertises itself by the wafting aroma from the kitchen, and seasoning food is a job that Tania, a young 26 year old woman, has done well for two years.  She has a small food sales business, and this is how she strives to raise her son. Tania is requesting this loan because she wishes to purchase ingredients she uses in her meals such as rice, meat, vegetables, and other products.  Her objective is to grow her business and provide better customer service.  Her goals are to continue her business, and to build it more to have better working conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients she uses in her meals such as rice, meat, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Ana Lucia Yamilet

texts.es:
Ana Lucia es una joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Educacion de Ciencias Sociales, ella solicita un prestamo para cubrir los gastos de sus estudios y esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Ana Lucia, tengo 18 años y vivo con mis padres y dos hermanos, uno de los cuales trabaja y el otro estudia, mi padre trabaja en una empresa y con esa nos mantiene ya que mi madre no trabaja en estos momentos. Actualmente estoy cursando la Licenciatura en Educación básica mención Lengua Española y Ciencias Sociales en la  Universidad Central del Este porque me gusta enseñar y quiero contribuir con el desarrollo de la educación de mi país. 

Mi familia no tiene muchos recursos y la universidad es un poco costosa además de que tengo que viajar a diario y no cuento con los recursos suficiente para ellos solicito de este préstamo para poder terminar mis estudios ya que recién empiezo, actualmente solo tengo un cuatrimestre.

 Tengo una beca para la matricula pero necesito de su ayuda para la compra de los materiales, el transporte y sostenimiento, si me ayudan con mi solicitud podre seguir estudiando y hare todo lo posible para mantener mi beca y terminar con honores mis estudios y ayudar de alguna manera con mi preparación y conocimiento.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is a young student of Social Sciences Education. She is requesting a loan to cover the costs of her studies and this is her story.

"My name is Ana Lucia. i am 18 years old and live with my parents and two brothers, one of whom works, while the other studies. My father works in a company and doing this he supports us as my mother isn't working at this time. I am currently studying for my degree in basic Education, majoring in the Spanish Language and Social Sciences at the Universidad Central del Este as I enjoy teaching and want to contribute to the development of education in my country.

My family have little resources and the university is somewhat costly. Also i have to pay to travel each day and don't have enough resources to do this. So I am requesting this loan to be able to complete my studies that i recently started. I only have studied one semester. I have a scholarship to cover tuition but i need help to pay for materials, transportation and to live.

If you help me with my request I can continue to study and will do all I can to maintain my scholarship and complete my studies with honors. Which will help me with my preparation and knowledge".

loans.use: for higher education expenses.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, es una mujer humilde, que inicio primeramente con un negocio fritangas, pero diversas circunstancias en su vida la han llevado ahora a tener una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus dos hijos, por quienes lucha día a día para salir adelante.  

Doña Rosa solicita el crédito para surtir su pulpería, mediante la compra de útiles escolares y granos básicos, etc. con el objetivo de captar mayor clientela, ya que esto le ayudará en el aumento de sus ganancias. Sus planes son seguir creciendo, comprar unos estantes de metal y algunas vitrinas, y entre sus metas esta seguir adelante con su familia y solicitar un crédito para el financiamiento de los estudios de su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Rosa is a humble woman who once had a small restaurant business, but varying circumstances in her life have led her to now run a small general store from her home. She counts on help from her husband and two sons and she struggles every day to keep going for them.
  
Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy school supplies and basic grains etc. to stock her general store. Her aim is to attract more customers since this will in turn help her to increase profits. She plans keep growing, to buy some metal shelves and glass window panes. One of her goals is to keep providing for her family and to ask for a loan to help finance her eldest son’s studies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and basic grains etc.

loans.name: Karen Guadalupe

texts.es:
Karen, de 21 años de edad, es empleada y su nivel de estudio fue hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres.

Karen, trabaja como tutora en un centro de desarrollo infantil desde hace 4 años, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo porque le gusta enseñar a los niños a leer y a escribir, con eso lograra obtener ingresos para sus gastos y alimentación diaria; para llegar a su trabajo tiene que viajar 2 kilómetros en moto-taxi y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución es, para comprar útiles escolares y pagar la mensualidad de la universidad.

El sueño de Karen es, ser maestra, tener un terreno y construir una vivienda de ladrillo, ya que en la que vive por el momento es la de sus padres. Además, desea tener un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Karen, 21, works and has a high school education.  She in single, doesn’t have any children, and lives with her parents. She has worked as a tutor at a child development center for four years.  She decided to engage in this job because she enjoys teaching children to read and write and, in this way, she manages to earn income for her expenses and daily meals.  To get to work, she has to travel two kilometers by motorcycle taxi, and she works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan from the institution to purchase school supplies, and pay monthly college tuition.  Karen’s dream is to be a teacher, and buy land to construct a brick home because the place she lives in right now belongs to her parents.  In addition, she wishes to have a business selling clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, and pay monthly college tuition.

loans.name: Obida

texts.en:
Obida is a generous woman. She was born in 1957. She is living in a small town. She is married. She has four children. Her husband works in government. 

Obida is busy with starting a business of buying and selling jewelry. She is planning to start her activity from the beginning. She wants to buy new qualified jewelry with accessible prices. 

She is asking for financial support from KIVA  to start up her business.

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Sonia Eloisa

texts.es:
Sonia, está casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años, su actividad económica es elaborar pupusas para vender y atender una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, su negocio tiene 3 años de estar funcionando y es un oficio que aprendió de su hermana, trabaja todos los días, la idea de tener su propio negocio ha surgido debido a la necesidad de ser un apoyo para su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Solicita un crédito para invertir en bebidas, aceite, tomates, boquitas, harina, quesillo, loroco, jabón, etc., surtirá el inventario del negocio para incrementar las ventas e ingresos, espera atraer nuevos clientes y  así brindarles un buen servicio.
Sonia sueña con luchar día con día para cumplir con el pago de sus deudas y para tener los recursos necesarios con los que le pagara los estudios universitarios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sonia is married. She lives with her husband and her 18-year-old son. She makes a living preparing pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) for sale and managing a store that sells staple goods. Her business has been open for the past 3 years. She learned this work from her sister, and she works every day. She had the idea of establishing her own business as a result of her need to support her husband with household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, oil, tomatoes, snacks, flour, fresh cheese, loroco (a vine flower bud), soap, etc. in order to stock her business so that she can increase her sales and her income. She hopes to attract new customers and, this way, to offer them a good service. Sonia dreams of working hard day after day in order to pay off her debts and to have the necessary resources to pay for her son's college education.

loans.use: to buy beverages, oil, tomatoes, snacks, flour, fresh cheese, loroco, soap, etc. in order to stock her business so that she can increase her sales and her income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair scaffolding, as well as purchase levels, a sledge hammer, and a trowel.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products to sell in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Corazon dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of grocery items to sell at retail.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She is a dairy farmer and also sells dairy products. She has been in this business for last 20 years, and the business has been profitable.

Jane will be using this loan to buy dairy feeds, farm inputs, and farm equipment. These purchases will help her serve her customers well. She will use the anticipated profits to buy basic needs, such as food and clothes, for her family.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed, farm imputs, and farm equipment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 14 years. They all go to school. 

She owns a shop and she has been in business for 10 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy colgate, rice, maize flour and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy colgate, rice, maize flour and salt to sell.

loans.name: Miladis Del Socorro

texts.es: Miladis es madre soltera y se esfuerza cada día para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su hijo de 4 años, que está en pleno crecimiento. Las ganas que caracterizan a esta humilde mujer y el empeño que ha puesto por salir adelante le han ayudado a incrementar el inventario de su pulpería.
