Es por esta razón que para seguir creciendo solicita un crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su pulpería con la compra de productos de la temporada escolar como: lapiceros, lápices, cuadernos, marcadores. También, surtir su negocio con granos básicos. Miladis, planea ampliar su local con las ganancias y continuar trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Miladis is a single mother, and she makes an effort every day to give her growing 4-year-old son a better life. This humble woman's desire and the determination with which she works to move forward have helped her increase the inventory of her small grocery store.

In order to keep growing, she is requesting a loan so that she can continue investing in her small grocery store. She will buy products for the school season such as pens, pencils, notebooks, and markers. In addition, she will stock her business with basic grains. Miladis plans to expand her store with her earnings and to continue working hard.

loans.use: to buy products for the school season such as pens, pencils, notebooks, and markers.

loans.name: Saparbu

texts.ru: Сапарбу, 63 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Сапарбу - среднее образование. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Сапарбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров. На участке мерою 0,5 Га арендованной и 0,13 Га собственной земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сапарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит отремонтировать сарай для животных.
texts.en:
Saparbu is 63 and a widow with three children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for her family, a business she started 15 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has six cows on her farm as well as 0.5 hectares of rented and 0.13 hectares of her own land where she grows barley for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Saparbu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase sheep to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock, which will allow her to renovate her barn.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep to increase her number of livestock

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Devotha is 32 years old. She is married with two children, aged 5 and 11 years. They both go to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for eight years, while her husband is a businessman.

With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, biscuits, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children

In the future, she wishes to earn 95% from the business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, biscuits, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Berina

texts.en:
Berina is 34 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of  6 and 10 years. They all go to school. 

She owns a shop and she has been in business for 12 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan, Berina would like to buy more sweets, biscuits and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.  

She wants to expand her business by 85%.

loans.use: To buy more sweets, biscuits and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Snoul district in Kratie province, 33-year-old Sokchea is a married woman with three schooling children. To earn a living, she has been planting cassava for 8 years, while her husband is a paid-worker. 

Sokchea is leading her group, which consists of three members. This is her second time being with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for 1,600,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sophy is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children that are in secondary school. 

She has been planting cassava for 13 years to finance the family budget. She also has a rice farm. 

Sophy has successfully been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) 4 cycles before and now she is pursuing a loan of 5,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire workers to plow the field as well as to buy another piece of land, for her cassava plantation. 

Her goal is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, to hire workers to plow the field, and to buy another piece of land.

loans.name: Seypha's Group

texts.en:
Seypha is a 52-year-old villager of the Koh Sotin district in Kampong Cham province. She is a widow with no children. 

She has been a fruit seller at a local market for 36 years. She also grows tobacco. Seypha has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, twice before, and is now leading her team.

Seypha is seeking a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, pesticide and tobacco seed for her plantation. 

She hopes that the profit from her business will financially raise her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and tobacco seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Living is a small rural village of Memot district, Kampong Cham province, Chan is a 46-year-old married man with four children. Two of the children are his dependents. To support his family, he and his wife have been planting cassava for the last seven years.

Chan has been with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund) for three cycles, counting this time. Leading his group, he is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his cassava plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Phiny

texts.en:
Phiny is a resident of Sambour district of Kratie province. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Five of the children are living with her and her husband.

She has been selling vegetables and fish at the market for 27 years in order to make a living. She also trades in cows for a secondary income.

This is her fourth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The former loans allowed her to buy more cows to sell, build a new house, and buy a motorcycle.

She is seeking a loan to buy cows to sell, to purchase vegetables and fish for her store, and to repair her house. She wishes for her family’s living standard to be improved.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell, to purchase vegetables and fish for her store, and to repair her house.

loans.name: Dalin's Group

texts.en:
Dalin is 42 years old and married with two children. They are living in a rural village of the Sangke district in Battambang province. 

One of the children is still her dependent and he is studying in university. The family's main source of income is from her husband being a doctor. 

Dalin raises pigs at home to sell for extra income, and she has been doing it for 10 years. She has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for 9 cycles. 

Leading her team, she is applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy pigs and pig feed. She hopes that her pigs will grow well so that she can sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.en:
Mavjigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1970. She is living in a remote district. She is married. She has two children. 

She is living in bad conditions and she has no money for making it better. She is working in a boarding school. Her duty is looking out for disabled people and elders. 

Mavjigul wants to have a better standard of living and is asking for financial support to renovate her house. 

She requested a 3,500 TJS loan for buying materials like sand, cement, wood and roofing for the renovation.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, wood, and roofing for the renovation.

loans.name: Wendy Esmeralda

texts.es:
Wendy, tiene una venta de celulares y accesorios para los mismos, en su negocio también se realizan reparaciones de celulares, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ambos trabajan juntos y ofrecen empleo a otra persona para que los apoye en atender a los clientes, trabajan ocho horas todos los días, pues tiene mucha demanda y su cartera de clientes está creciendo.
Utilizará el capital para la compra de celulares, carcasas, cargadores, baterías, etc., y realizara remodelaciones en el local de su negocio, esta inversión le da los recursos económicos para renovar su mercadería y cambiar la imagen del negocio.
Aspira posicionar su negocio en el mercado por encima de la competencia, cancelar su deuda y lo más importante que es sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy makes a living selling mobile phones as well as mobile phone accessories. Her business also provides mobile phone repairs. She lives with her husband and one son. They work together, and they offer employment to one other person, who helps them serve customers. They work eight hours every day, as they have a lot of demand and their customer base is growing.

She will use this loan to buy mobile phones, cases, chargers, batteries, etc. and to remodel her business stall. This loan will provide her with economic resources to renew her merchandise and to change the image of her business. She dreams of positioning her business on top of the competition in the market, repaying her loan, and, most importantly, moving her family forward.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, cases, chargers, batteries, etc. and to remodel her business stall.

loans.name: Roger Anibal

texts.es:
Roger tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace nueve años, tiene dos hijas de 11 y 4 años de edad y solo la mayor de ellas estudia.

Roger tiene experiencia en la comercialización de bebidas gaseosas, jugos y pan, él compra a las fabricas que elaboran el producto  y lo distribuye en tiendas al mayoreo y al detalle, él realiza esta actividad desde hace 13 años y para la distribución del producto  utiliza su vehículo. 

Roger necesita este crédito para comprar mercadería como pan, gaseosas y jugos, también necesita para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo.

Su sueño es ser un distribuidor mayoritario ya que solo cuenta con un empleado a quien él tiene que pagarle. El quiere dos vehículos más y de esa manera generar mas empleos directos, mejorar su calidad de vida y darle una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Roger is 39 years old, and studied though high school, and he is married and his spouse has sold tortillas for 9 years.  He has two children, ages 11 and 4, and only the oldest is studying.  

Roger has experience marketing soft drinks, juices and bread.  He buys from the factories that make the products and distributes them at wholesale and retail stores.  He has been in this business for 13 years and uses his vehicle for the distribution of products.   Roger needs this loan to buy merchandise such as bread, soft drinks, juices and also to do maintenance on his vehicle.   His dream is to be a major distributor, as he currently has just one employee who he has to pay.   He wants to have two additional cars and create more direct jobs, improve his quality of life and give a better life to his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bread, sodas and juices, and also to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Sros is a 30-year-old married woman with two dependent children. They are living in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district in Kampong Cham province. 

Her husband is a construction worker, while she has been managing a small grocery store for 14 years. Both of them are able to save 5 USD every day. 

Now, her second time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the leader of her team, Sros is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to start a cassava plantation. 

She plans to rent a piece of land, to buy fertilizer and tobacco seed and to hire workers to plow the field. 

She hopes that the new business will run well so that the family's financial status will be improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and tobacco seed, and to hire workers to plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Pineaple Grp Musoma Group

texts.en:
Hapiness, who is in her early 20s, is married with one child who is still small. She has been running two projects: selling CDs and DVDs and selling juice in the same place. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hapiness's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is happy with her loan experiences. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of CDs and DVDs and started selling juice. She used the profit to cover household expenses and loan dues and saved some in her bank account. She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully.

She will use this loan to buy good, up-to-date films on CD and DVD and to increase her stock of juice to meet customer demand. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

Hapiness will share this loan with her loan group, "Pineaple Grp Musoma," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy good, up-to-date films on CD and DVD and to increase her stock of juice to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 45 years old. He is married with three children aged between four and 12 years. Two of them go to school. He owns a canteen and has been in business for 12 years. His wife is a teacher. With the loan, he would like to buy more baking powder in order to make more snacks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more baking powder for making more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Koem Horn

texts.en:
Koem Horn, 34, lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business of a small rice farmland which is located in her community.

So far, she has been in this type of business for more than ten years.  She is able to make an earning of USD 4.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is a married woman living in Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than three years now. This is their main source of income. April dreams of expanding their fishing business. 

For this, she would like to avail a loan to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks, and wood and nails for the repair of the fishing boat. 

April believes that a loan will help them improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, April hopes of making their fishing business a success and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks, and wood and nails for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. Jocelyn is holding a bucket of crabs and fish. She sells them to her customers in her place.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan to buy materials for fishing such as nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters. A loan will help her and her husband improve their fishing venture, thus, augmenting their income and profit.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Phaey

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Kratie province, Phaey is a 26-year-old wife and a mother of two young children. One of them is in school, while another is under the age of 6. To make a living, Phaey has been growing cassava for 8 years. Sometimes, she and her husband work as paid-workers to earn additional income. She manages to save around 5 USD daily. 

Phaey is a credible client. She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for three cycles previously. Now leading her group, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation. She wishes that her family's financial situation will be better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 24-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and one child. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for three years; he alone is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Maria's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of clothes, lots of needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. 

Therefore, Maria has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to get these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Maria is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different tailoring accessories for her husband's business

loans.name: Parkpang Group

texts.en:
Moun understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Moun knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Moun purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. 

Moun is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakheuanai Group

texts.en:
Bang understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Bang knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Bang purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Bang is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo, 32, is a farmer living in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has two children ages 9 and 4. 

Leo has been in the rice farming business for more than four years now. This is the source of his income. Leo is asking to take a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This loan will help him improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his yield and profit. In the future, 

Leo dreams of expanding his rice field. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Nakuang Group

texts.en:
Pome is excited the filter is available on an affordable, payment plan. Pome and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filter Pome and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Pome and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Pome and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a biogas system to have a smoke-free kitchen for cooking

loans.name: Xiengtor Group

texts.en:
Tia’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Tia and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Tia and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets.

 The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Tia’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nanoy Group

texts.en: Daeng is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Daeng and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Daeng and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Daeng and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Daeng and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara, requiere de más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, una bomba achicadora y pagara obreros para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara granos básicos, se limitara a comprar lo necesario para continuar trabajando en el campo y tener un sistema de riego más efectivo.
El efecto del crédito anterior en su negocio ha sido positivo, ya que la mantiene la platanera produciendo mucho más y preparó la tierra en el tiempo justo para sembrar granos básicos y pipián, las condiciones de vida sean optimizado y está teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Clara needs more capital to buy agricultural inputs, a water pump, and to pay for workers to prepare the soil in which she will grow basic grains. She will limit herself to buying what is needed to continue working in the fields and to have a more effective irrigation system. The effect of her previous loan has been positive, because the banana plant is producing much more, and she prepared the soil at the right time to grow basic grains and pipian. The conditions have been optimized and she is obtaining better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, a water pump, and to pay for workers to prepare the soil in which she will grow basic grains.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 1ro Del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene sus expectativas puestas en el programa, ya que a través de esto podrán ir mejorando su situación de vida y las de sus familias. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les podrá ayudar a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Cada una de ellas pone su mejor esfuerzo en ir creciendo y mejorando, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Cinthia, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que por medio de su esfuerzo puede ir mejorando cada día. Cinthia tiene una modesta peluquería que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar y hoy día ya tiene una clientela bien formada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named Santa Lucia is in its 1rst cycle of the Women's Committee program. It is a new group that has placed its hope in the program, since through it they can improve their and their family's life situations. They are also a part of the the poverty elimination program that can help them to improve their standard of living. 

Each of them puts her best effort into growing and improving. One of them who stands out is Cinthia, who is the president of the group. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person. She says that through her hard work she can improve every day. Cinthia has a modest hair salon which she was able to open with a lot of hard work. Today she has a well established clientele. She is asking for this loan to invest in buying materials for her hair salon, such as creams, shampoo, conditioners, dyes and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, conditioners, dyes and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toner, printing paper and do maintenance on the computers.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis de 30 años de edad, es bachiller, actualmente esta casado y su esposa se dedica a a los oficios domésticos y tiene dos hijos  que asisten a la escuela. 
Alexis trabaja como vigilante en un casino y su tiempo libre trabaja en  agricultura, siendo estos sus medios mas fuertes de ingresos económicos. 
Él necesita el crédito para reparar el carro y para comprar insumos agrícolas, le servirá de mucho ya que trabaja de noche y se transporta con su carro.
Sus planes son seguir ayudando a sus hijos con el estudio, hasta verlos como profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Alexis is 30 years old, and he has a high school education. He is currently married, and his wife is dedicated to the household chores. He has 2 children that attend school.

Alexis works as a guard in a casino, and in his free time he works on the farm. These are his strongest means of financial income. He is requesting a loan to repair his car and to buy farming supplies. This will help him a lot because he works at night and uses his car to get there. His plans are to keep helping his children with their schooling until he sees them become successful professionals.

loans.use: to repair his car and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
José tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación basica, está casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de antojitos como yuca pastelitos, enchiladas y mas, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos estudian y los otros dos ya son personas independientes. 

José es pastor de una iglesia y también trabaja en agricultura o cualquier otro trabajo que se le presente  y que le genere ingresos. 

Él solicita este crédito para para comprar 2 terneros. 

Su sueño a futuro es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y que formen una buena familia.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and studied through 9th grade of grade school.  He is married and his wife sells snacks such as yuca pastries, enchiladas and more.  He has 4 children; two are studying and the others are independent adults.  Jose is a pastor in a church and also works in agriculture and any other job that presents itself and generates income.   

He is requesting a loan to buy two calves.  His dream in the future is that his children will study and start good families.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Nueva Group

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 25 y 20 años, y su negocio es el comercio de condimentos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ’16 de julio’ caracterizada por el comercio informal; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco (2ºC -12ºC), a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Rosalia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza  (sentada la primera de la derecha, viste de negro). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudia a nivel técnico y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y adobe y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Los deseos de ayudar a sus hijos mejorando el comercio de su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de jugos, venta de comida, venta de chompas, servicio de fotocopias, atención de cabinas telefónicas, venta de medias y venta de flores, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de condimentos como; ají, ajo, orégano, comino, pimienta y otros. Labor que realiza durante el día y hasta largas horas de la noche en un puesto de venta fijo cercano a su domicilio; “no tengo ninguna dificultad en mi negocio, sólo alguna pequeña competencia, pero en el lugar transita mucha gente y por eso me va bien…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande con vendedores que administrar, ella desea aumentar su mercadería realizando la compra de mayor cantidad de condimentos para ofertar por mayor. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Rosalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de condimentos para realizar la venta por mayor.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 49 year-old woman, single, and has two sons who are 25 and 20 years old.  She has a business selling condiments.  She is a good mother, independent, entrepreneurial, patient, responsible, and hardworking.  She operates her business in the area called “16 de julio,” characterized by its informal trade, where you can find everything from a needle to sew to a tractor to plough.  The climate is cold and dry (2ºC -12ºC), with an average elevation of 3,800 meters above sea level.

Rosalia is strong, has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, dark eyes, a short stature, and she dresses traditionally (sombrero, shawl, and pollera—a traditional multi-layered skirt).  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, while she speaks Spanish with the general public and for her trade.  (She is seated first on the right, dressed in black.)  She shares her life with her sons who are studying trades and working.  They live in their own house made of brick and clay, with drinkable water, electricity, gas, and plumbing.  Her desire to help her children by improving her business sales has brought her to lead a bank of people (with businesses such as juice, food, flower, sweater, and stocking sales, photocopying services, and telephone booth repairs), to request a loan and achieve her goals. 

Her business is selling condiments like pepper, garlic, oregano and cumin, among others.  She works during the day and until the late hours of the night in a booth near her home, commenting, “I do not have any difficulties with my business, just a little competition, but many people move through the location and that’s why I’m doing well.”  Her dream is to have a large business with sellers who run the shop.  She wishes to increase her merchandise by purchasing a greater quantity of condiments to sell at wholesale.  This is the fourth sequence of loans in seven years that she has received from this institution and she continues with her business independently.

It is for these reasons that Rosalia is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of condiments to sell at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of condiments to sell at wholesale

loans.name: María Juana Dolores

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo y los cuidados del hogar, estudió hasta 4to grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo y al cuido de animales, tienen 3 hijas, pero solo dos de ellas viven junto en casa, pues la mayor está acompañada.

Juana ha vivido toda su vida en el campo, desde que era pequeña sus padres le enseñaron que debía trabajar duro para ganarse la vida, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de queso fresco, elaborado con la leche obtenida de los animales que su esposo ordeña diariamente, y que venden a los vecinos. Sus hijas se involucran a los quehaceres de la casa y también contribuyen con la elaboración del queso.

El Préstamo solicitado es para comprar los materiales necesarios como cemento, arena, hierro y el pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un corredor y una fosa séptica en su casa.

Su sueño es ir prosperando con el negocio del queso, de manera que pudiera vender un poco más, para así darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y que pudieran llegar a ser profesionales y que sean un ejemplo en su comunidad, también sueña con ir mejorando poco a poco su casa que es un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
39 year old Juana is a woman who is very dedicated to her work and taking care of her home. She studied in elementary school up to 4th grade, she is married and her husband earns a living growing corn and sorghum and raising livestock. They have three daughters, but only two of them are minors and live at home.

Juana has lived her whole life in the country, since she was little her parents taught her that she should work hard to gain in life. Now, she earns a living producing fresh cheese, made from the milk from the animals that her husband milks daily, which is sold to the neighbors. Her daughters are involved in the house chores and also contribute to the production of cheese. 

The requested loan is to buy necessary materials like cement, sand, and iron and to pay for labor for the construction of a veranda and septic tank for her home.

Her dream is to continue prospering with her cheese business, in a way that she can sell a little more to give a better quality of life to her daughters so that they can become professionals and by an example within the community. She also dreams to continue improving her house, which is a family inheritance.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials like cement, sand, and iron and to pay for labor for the construction of a veranda and septic tank for her home.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en: Twenty-six years of age, Lak is a villager of Snoul district in Kratie province. She is married and has one young kid who is under six years old. For eight years, Lak has been growing cassava in order to support the family. Her secondary source of income is from being a paid worker. As a leader of her group and a new member of Kiva’s partner (VisionFund), Lak is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to hire workers to plough the field and to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She hopes that her plantation will produce a higher yield.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kasae Group

texts.en: Thone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Thone and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.  Thone and her village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within these 2 years, filter users, like Thone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en: Nesa is a sari-sari store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. The 43-year-old mother of six has operated her store for more than 14 years now. This is her source of income. Nesa also earns additional income through rice farming. Nesa is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like biscuits and chips, noodles, canned sardines, candies, cooking oil and seasonings, dried fish, rice, soap and detergents. She also wants to buy fertilizer for the farm. Nesa believes that a loan will help her improve her business and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like biscuits and chips, noodles, canned sardines, candies, cooking oil and seasonings, dried fish, rice, soap and detergents

loans.name: Xoekthang Group

texts.en: Noy understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Noy knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Noy purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the amount of money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Noy is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, de 70 años de edad, es jornalero, no estudio porque sus padres decidieron enseñarle a trabajar para que pudiera ayudar con los gastos de la casa, está acompañado y junto con su compañera de vida tienen 7 hijos, los cuales ya todos están acompañados y trabajan para sus propios hogares.

Timoteo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 60 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio, para llegar a su trabajo tiene que caminar 3 kilómetros y su horario es de 4:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando, es para comprar 2 novillas, las cuales dentro de un periodo le darán un poco más de ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Los sueños de Timoteo son, llegar a tener una yunta de bueyes y que su nieta estudie, para que pueda tener mejores posibilidades de trabajo. Además, llegar a tener un terreno para construir una vivienda de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Timoteo, 70 years old, is a day laborer.  He did not study because his parents decided to teach him to work so that he could help with household expenses.  He lives with his wife, together with whom he has seven children, who are already married and work for their own households.

For 60 years, Timoteo has made a living in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his parents, who always have dedicated themselves to this business.  In order to arrive at his work, he has to walk three kilometers (1.9 miles) and his schedule is from 4:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. every day.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy two heifers, which will give him a little more income for awhile in order to give his family a better quality of life.  Timoteo’s dreams are to have a team of bulls and for her granddaughter to study so that she can have better work opportunities, and also to have land to build a brick house.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La producción agrícola casi siempre está relacionada a oficio de hombres, sin embargo existen mujeres fuertes y trabajadoras que han demostrado que los estereotipos sociales no existen. Y es que Isabel, ha podido sembrar y cosechar frijoles, sin ningún contratiempo. Ella se siente muy contenta de haber lograr siempre buena cosecha.

Isabel solicita un crédito para ampliar su terreno de cosecha, pues tiene la oportunidad de comprar un área contigua a su propiedad. Esto le será beneficioso, pues podrá cosechar más productos y por consiguiente, sus ingresos incrementaran al doble.
texts.en:
Agricultural production is almost always related to a man's occupation, however there are strong and hard-working women that have demonstrated that these social stereotypes do not exist. Isabel has been able to plant and harvest beans without any setbacks. She feels very content to have always achieved a good harvest.

Isabel is requesting a loan to increase her land for harvesting. She has the opportunity to buy a lot next to her property. This will be very beneficial to her because she will be able to harvest more products, and as a result her revenues will increase by double.

loans.use: to increase her land for harvesting.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods like rice, noodles, bread and snack foods, detergents and other items. Maria Fe is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, canned goods, rice, cooking oil and condiments, beverages, soft drinks, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods. With this, Maria Fe will be able to improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Maria Fe hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, canned goods, rice, cooking oil and condiments, beverages, soft drinks, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha is a 40-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Martha has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Martha described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Martha’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josselin Xiomara

texts.es:
Josselin, de 22 años de edad, actualmente está casada y no tinene hijos.

Josselin, se dedica a hacer pan, aprendió en una capacitación que fue impartida, en un lugar aledaño a su comunidad.

Anteriomente Josselin, se dedicaba a la venta de pupusas en las afueras de su casa, luego al aprender el nuevo oficio, decidió dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, el cual hace por las mañanas.

El préstamo que Josselin necesita es, para comprar harina, frutas, levadura, y bandejas que le hacen falta para elaborar el producto.

Sus metas a futuro son continuar con el negocio, ampliarlo para obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josselin is 22 years old. She is currently married and has no children. Josselin earns a living making bread, which she learned at a training that was given in a place close to her community.

Previously Josselin was working selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] outside of her home. Then - after learning the new occupation - she decided to focus on making bread, which she does in the mornings. The loan that Josselin is requesting is to buy flour, fruit, yeast, and pans that she needs to make her product. Her future goals are to continue with the business and expand it to obtain a greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, fruit, yeast, and pans that she needs to make her product.

loans.name: Maiyas' Group

texts.en: Maiyas is a resident of Keo Seima district in Mondulkiri province. She is 27 years old and married. She has two young kids who are her dependents. Maiyas has been growing cassava for 12 years. To earn extra income, she works as a paid worker. This is Maiyas' first time being a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a leader of her team, she is seeking a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy cassava stems and to hire workers to plough the land and to plant the cassavas. She hopes that her plantation will be more productive so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy cassava stems and to hire workers to plough the land and to plant the cassava

loans.name: Hector Uriel

texts.es: Hector de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee un cibercafé ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene en su trabajo logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de tornes de tintas, papel para impresiones y darle mantenimiento a las computadoras para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Hector, 35 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and their daughter.  For 8 years, he has owned a cybercafé located in his place of residence.  He has many clients.  With what he has obtained from his work, he has managed to get ahead in life.  He is requesting a loan to purchase ink cartridges and printer paper, and to perform maintenance on the computers in order to continue with his work, as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase ink cartridges and printer paper, and to perform maintenance on the computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile accessories.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is a conscientious divorced woman with three children. She was born in 1981 and lives in a village. She is a grocery store seller but dreams of owning her own business. Gulshan wants to open a store and is planning to borrow 1,000 USD to start this activity. Gulshan is requesting Kiva financial support to purchase products for her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's embroidery shop.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra es una joven estudiante de Odontologia, ella solicita un prestamo para poder pagar sus gastos y sus estudios esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Alexandra, tengo 23 años, nací y crecí en Moca, provincia Espaillat. Tengo 4 hermanos y soy soltera. Estudio odontología en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) en la vega RD. 
Entre las materias que he dado están: bioestadística, anatomía I, epidemiologia, embriología bucal, introducción a la psicología, microbiología bucal, anatomía cabeza y cuello, histología, anatomía dental, periodoncia I, materiales dentales, bioética, radiología dental, diagnostico y patología I. De las que más me han gustado son, anatomía I, embriología bucal y microbiología bucal.
Necesito este préstamo porque no tengo las posibilidades económicas  necesarias para seguir estudiando,  vivo con mis abuelos, mi madre vive en otra provincia, no trabaja y no tiene recursos para ayudarme por lo que de no tener el préstamo no podre lograr mi sueño, y  cumplir mis metas, ser profesional  y darle al mundo una persona diferente y llena de capacidades y características tanto intelectuales, como de diferentes formas que sirvan como ayuda para el mismo. En verdad que este préstamo cambiaria mi vida en gran manera, en primer lugar  porque abriría una puerta hacia la superación que es algo que siempre he admirado pero sobre todo he deseado, y en segundo lugar, porque me convertiría en una mejor persona ya que por medio de este podré seguir estudiando y de esta forma podré adquirir los conocimientos que necesito para culminar mis estudios y desarrollarme como profesional en el medio social.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young dentistry student.  She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her education costs. This is her story:  

My name is Alexandra, I am 23 and born and raised in Moca, in the province of Espaillat.   I have 4 siblings and I am single.  I study dentistry at the Technical Catholic University of Cibao in La Vega, Dominican Republic

Among the courses I have taken there is:  Biostatistics, Anatomy 1, Epidemiology, Oral Embryology, Introduction to Psychology, Oral Microbiology, Anatomy of the head and neck, Histology, Dental Anatomy, Periodontics 1, Dental courses, Bioethics, Dental Radiology, Diagnostics and Pathology 1.  The ones that I have liked the most are Anatomy 1, Oral Embryology, and Oral Microbiology.  

I need this loan because I don't have the necessary economic means to continue studying.  I live with my grandparents and my mother lives in another province, where she doesn't have a job or the resources to help me.  Without this loan, I will not be able to achieve my dream, accomplish my goals to be a professional and give to the world a different person full of capabilities and characteristics, intellectual as well as other characteristics that serve the same goal.  

Truly, this loan would change my life in a great way.  First, because it would open a door towards self-improvement, which is something I have always admired and above all, desired.  Secondly, it would make me a better person because though this loan I could continue studying and aquaria the knowledge necessary to finish my studies and develop as a professional in the social environment.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 66 años de edad, es una señora trabajadora, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues desde pequeña la mandaron a trabajar, está felizmente acompañada y su pareja se dedica a realizar oficios de albañilería, tiene 3 hijos mayores que ya tienen sus propios hogares, por lo tanto vive sola junto con su esposo.


Ana trabajó en algodoneras y cafetales desde joven, cuando cumplió 25 años emigró para la capital en busca de mejores oportunidades, estando allá trabajó realizando oficios domésticos, a los 35 años regresó a su comunidad y se volvió a acompañar y fue aquí cuando decidió iniciar su propio negocio de destazo de cerdos, también elabora tamales de gallina y de frijoles que sale a vender a pie casa por casa.


El Préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego destazarlos para vender su carne y así obtener mayores ganancias económicas, también necesita invertir en compra de maíz para la elaboración de los tamales.

Ana sueña con seguir mejorando el negocio de cerdos para que así pueda gozar de los pocos años de vida que le quedan al lado de su esposo, también aspira a que sus hijos prosperen con sus hogares y se mantengan unidos siempre.
texts.en:
Ana, 66 years old, is a hardworking woman.  She did not have the opportunity to study because she was sent to work when she was little.  She is happily married and her partner makes a living in the masonry trade.  She has three older children who now have their own households; therefore, she lives just with her husband.

From a young age, Ana worked on cotton and coffee plantations.  When she turned 25, she emigrated to the capital in search of better opportunities and was there doing domestic work.  At the age of 35, she returned to her community and got married, and it was here that she decided to start her own pig butcher business.  She also makes chicken and bean tamales that she goes from house to house selling.

She needs the requested loan to buy pigs to raise, to butcher, and to sell the meat in order to have better earnings.  She also needs to invest in the purchase of corn to make her tamales.  Ana dreams of continuing to improve the pig business so that she can enjoy the few years of her life that she has with her husband.  She also aspires for her children to prosper with their households and to stay together forever.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, to butcher, and to sell the meat in order to have better earnings

loans.name: Nelson Omar

texts.es:
Nelson, de 22 años de edad, es agricultor y estudio hasta el séptimo grado, no siguió estudiando porque decidió acompañarse y ahora junto con su pareja tiene un bebe de 1 año de edad, su compañera de vida es comerciante.

Nelson, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien siempre se dedico a la agricultura, para llegar a su trabajo tiene que viajar en bicicleta un kilometro y medio y su horario es de 5:00 a.m. a 12:00 del mediodía todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es, para comprar lámina y madera, para construir un cuarto.

El sueño de Nelson es, tener una casa propia, ya que en la que vive por el momento es la de su padre, además, desesa llegar a cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y seguir estudiando para tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nelson, 22 years old, is a farmer and studied until the seventh grade.  He did not continue because he decided to get married and now has a one-year-old baby with his wife, who is a vendor.  Nelson has made a living farming for 13 years, a trade that he learned from his father, who always made a living in the industry.  To get to his work, he has to travel by bicycle one and a half kilometers, and his work schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. every day.

The loan that he is requesting from this institution is to purchase sheet metal and wood to build a room.  Nelson’s dream is to have his own house, as the one he lives in right now is his father’s.  He wants to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn and continue studying to have better work opportunities.

loans.use: is to purchase sheet metal and wood to build a room

loans.name: Reberwet Tree Nursery Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Paul. He is 36 years old and is married with five children, ages ten to eighteen years old.

Paul farms maize, beans and potatoes. Having completed Eastern Africa’s training on savings and financial management, Hand in Hand, he has gained knowledge and skills on business management. He is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer, to help boost the crops yield . He plans to use the increased income to address family needs, including food and clothing. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.en:
Rogaciano is a motorcycle driver from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has two children.

Rogaciano earns a living through transporting passengers using his motorcycle. He also earns additional income through farming. Rogaciano has been in the business for more than 7 years now.

Rogaciano is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like a tire, chains and nuts, as well as fertilizer for the farm. A loan will help him to improve his business, thus augmenting his profits and income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like a tire, chains and nuts, as well as fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is a crab and fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children.

Severa has been in the fish vending business for several years now. This is the main source of her income. Severa is asking to take out a loan to buy more fish to sell. Severa believes that a loan will help her improve her business, thus augmenting her profits and income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nakangxea Group

texts.en:
Kongmanee is excited the water filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Kongmanee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Kongmanee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Kongmanee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease, and after totaling up the costs, Kongmanee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to allow access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a remote village of Snoul district in Kratie province, Aun is a 34-year-old married woman with two young children. She has been in the charcoal business for 16 years.

For her second time as a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s field partner, and as the leader of her group, Aun is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy wood to make charcoal.

She hopes that the business will be profitable so that she can keep sending her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Toe's Group

texts.en:
52-year-old Toe is married and has six children. One of her children is living with her and her husband in a rural village of Sambour district, in Kratie province. Her main source of income is from a cassava plantation, and it has been for the past 10 years.

This is her second time being a client of Kiva’s field partner VisionFund. She is a leader of her group of three and she is requesting a 1,500,000 KHR loan to hire workers to plough her field for cassava plantation. She wishes for her family's living standards to be improved.

loans.use: to hire workers to plough her field

loans.name: Vetaliana

texts.en:
Vetaliana is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Trinidad, Bohol. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store in her place.

Vetaliana sells various goods and foodstuffs to the people in her area. This is the source of her income.

Vetaliana is asking to take out a loan to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, biscuits & snack foods, cooking oil, and condiments, among other items. This loan will enable her to increase her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, biscuits & snack foods, cooking oil, and condiments, among other items

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is in his late 20s and is married with one small child.  He has two projects to earn income; selling charcoal and a motorcycle transportation business.  He works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Baraka's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal stock and to buy a motorcycle.  He is doing well and he has repaid all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to build his house, take care of his family, for loan repayments and for household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to service his motorcycle. He dreams of buying a vehicle to be able to deliver charcoal to his customers.  

Baraka will make sure he pays back the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the lathe machine for her husband's turner work

loans.name: Dorcas's Group

texts.en:
Doricas, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed of 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Doricas will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Doricas plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Doricas’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to cultivate a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her own stitching work

loans.name: Mbokomu Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a grocery store and a food vending business, for five years now. She works from 5:00 am to midnight daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Aisha's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store and started selling cooked food in the same shop.

She is doing great and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, start building her house and pay for household expenses. She will use this loan to buy drinks for the grocery store and to increase on her mamalishe stock in order to serve more customers.  She dreams of owning a Bar and a Guest house.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "MBOKOMU" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and to increase her mamalishe stock in order to serve more customers.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of two children, of whom one is attending school while the other is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Turdukan

texts.ru: Турдукан 63 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. На протяжении почти 40 лет, Турдукан занимается швейным бизнесом.  На сегодняшний день у Турдукан есть запасы материала на сумму 21,000 сом (KGS), преимущественно она шьет национальные изделия: одеяла, матрацы, подушки. Доходы от бизнеса составляют до 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турдукан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ткани и материалов для производства. Доходы от кредита Турдукан планирует вложить в покупку швейной машины для ее дочери, она хочет передать ей все свои навыки и подключить к семейному делу.
texts.en: Turdukan is 63 years old, married, and she has had two children.  She has been working as a seamstress for almost 40 years.  She currently has stocks of fabrics worth 21,000 som (KGS) and she essentially sews traditional Kyrgyz items such as comforters, mattresses and pillows.  She makes close to 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  This loan will be used to buy fabrics and other materials necessary for her activity.  Turdukan is planning to use the earnings from her loan to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.  She wants to transmit all her skills to her daughter and start a family business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other materials necessary for her sewing activity.

loans.name: Keangpham Group

texts.en:
Mork’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Mork and her group are excited that a water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Mork and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Mork’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира, 46 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи Эльмира 10 лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Начатый со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, на участке мерою 2,40 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Elmira is 46 years old, married, and she has raised four children.  She has a specialized-secondary education.  Ten years ago, she got involved in animal husbandry in order to provide a source of income for her family.  She started her business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS) and currently has five cows on her farm.  She also grows barley on 2.4 hectares of land.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy additional livestock for fattening.  Elmira is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her farming business, and also to repair her barn.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say, 54, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living, she has been involved in agri-business since 1980. By owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market.  On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2 per day.

In this farming season, she would like hire some people to clear the forest from a plot of her land in order to grow cassava.  Due to a shortage of money, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay to hire laborers. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clear the forest from a plot of her land in order to grow cassava

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.ru: Тазагул, 52 года, замужем. У Тазагул среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в далеком 1985 году. Благодаря упорному труду Тазагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 6 лошадей. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Tazagul is 52 years old and married.  She has a secondary education and, since 1985, she has been involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and six horses on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few horses.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase a few horses in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргис добрая, вежливая, общительная и ответственная женщина. У нее четверо детей в браке. Наргис с мужем работают вместе. Они занимаются продажей фруктов на местном рынке города. Они работают много и выходят на работу в любую погоду, потому что они хотят обеспечить своим детям все условия жизни. Он хотят дать им хорошее образование, чтобы в будущем они нашли себе хорошую работу и жили лучше их. Наргис обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" больше уделяет внимание женщинам-клиентам и создает большее приятные условия кредитования. Наргис считает, что сделала верный выбор, обращаясь за кредитом. Она на заемные деньги купит новый товар из нового урожая и тем самым привлечет больше покупателей.
texts.en: Nargiz is a kind, polite, social and responsible woman.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She and her husband work together: they sell fruits at a local market in town.  They work hard, under any weather conditions, because their goal is to provide their children with all the necessities of life.  Nargiz and her husband want to give their children a good education, so that in the future they can find good jobs and have better lives than their parents.  Nargiz is applying for a loan and has chosen MDO Humo for the care they provide to their female customers and for their good lending conditions.  Nargiz believes that she has made the right choice by taking a loan.  With the money from her loan, she will buy new produce from the latest harvest, which will help her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and attract more customers.

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
"Annah is 35 years old and has 6 children.  She has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual.  Even though Annah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Annah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Annah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Tursinoy

texts.en: Tursinoy is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1990. She is living in a remote district. She is an active, brave, patient and kind person. Tursinoy is divorced with one child. It is hard for her to care for her baby. She is busy with keeping livestock and selling them in domestic market. Also, she individually makes forage for her livestock. Tursinoy is an organized person and wishes to have better standard of living. She wants to buy cattle and increase her activity. She is asking for financial support from Kiva to support her family needs and buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Namdeua Group

texts.en: La’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  La and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that makes it much more affordable.  La will use her portion of the loan to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.  La and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like La’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 8 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano y perfumes.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la feria ’16 de julio’ un sitio considerada la feria más grande del país, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sara es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro usa blusa verde a rayas horizontales). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por darle una vida mejor a sus hijos la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas con negocio como; venta de polleras, venta de maní, venta de comida, venta de dulces, venta de buzos para niños, venta de utensilios de cocina y librería para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano y perfumes. Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo cosméticos, hace 2 años que emprendió el comercio de ropa de segunda mano y afirma que es un buen negocio. “en época de lluvias se me dificulta el comercio porque vendo a la intemperie, pero mi ventaja es que cuento con mi propio puesto de venta al aire libre…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una galería propia para la venta de ropa, ella desea aumentar el volumen de su oferta mediante la compra de variedades de ropa de segunda mano. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que se dedica a ambos negocios.
Es por esos motivos que Sara solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano para ofertar mayor variedad y darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is a single 38 year old woman who has an 8 year old son and a 5 year old daughter. Her business is selling secondhand clothing and perfumes.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, constant, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the '16th of July' fair, which is considered to be one of the country's largest, with a cold and dry climate that varies between 0-12 degrees Celsius during the day.

Sara is short, with dark skin, long black hair in a tethered horse tail style, dark eyes and a thin physique. Her native language is Aymará, which is spoken her family, and she speaks Spanish for general use and in business. She's standing in the center wearing a green blouse with horizontal stripes.

She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in a rented house which has potable water, electricity, gas and sewage. Her desire to give her children a better life led her to form a communal bank made of people with businesses like selling chickens, peanuts, food, sweets, children's tracksuits, kitchen utensils and books to seek loans and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling secondhand clothing and perfumes. She began her business selling cosmetics and began selling secondhand clothing two years ago. She says it's a good business. "During the rainy season, business is hard because I sell in the open, but my advantage is I have my own stall outdoors," she says. 

Her dream is to have her own store to sell clothing. She'd like to increase the volume of her offerings through buying varieties of secondhand clothing. This is the first sequence of loans in the institution. She's been doing both businesses for eight years.

For these reasons, Sara is seeking a loan to buy secondhand clothing to offer better variety and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to offer better variety and give her children a future.

loans.name: Amos's Group

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Amos has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Amos also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Amos's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala. She is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t have any additional family members. 

Eva sells second-hand clothes. She runs her business from home, and sells on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Eva has asked for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. Eva lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for utility bills, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 54-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children. She is from Moalboal, Cebu, in the Philippines. Her main work is selling food supplements to the people in her village. Emelia also earns an additional income through raising pigs. 

Emelia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and for animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, therefore increasing her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed
