texts.en: Dilbarniso is a young resident of the Jilikul district. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 11, who go to school. Her husband is 34 and is working in Russia. Dilbarniso plants crops on her own plot of land and this is the main source of income that provides for her family. She wants to buy fertilizers to plant her crops. Dilbarniso applied for a loan because she does not have enough money. You can support her. She trusts in your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 20-year-old single man from Qalqilia. He lives with his old parents in a very simple house. Amir started working selling fruits and vegetables two years ago. He buys fresh crops from the local farmers and resells them in the local market. It is a good business but still not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Amir took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more crops to resell on his fruit and vegetable stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Amir appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more crops to sell on his fruit and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Adolfo Jr

texts.en:
Adolfo is a married man and a father of a five-month-old baby from Moalboal, Cebu. He earns a living through a pedal rickshaw service. Adolfo has been in the business for several years now. 

Adolfo is asking for a loan to buy a new pedal rickshaw. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy a new pedal rickshaw.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad está en su ciclo número 11° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir esta en un nivel medio de pobreza. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas en su copetín tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Liz solicita de este préstamo para la compra de más cantidad de productos, para poder surtir su copetín con bebidas, galletitas, jugos, gaseosas y demás, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group La Amistad is in it's eleventh cycle of the program of the committee of women, where everyone works and helps each other to succeed. They are doing a survey of poverty elimination, where two members are below the poverty line, meaning in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Señora Liz. In her latest survey she showed a level of poverty within level two, meaning she is at a medium level of poverty. Through effort and continuous work, and through her sales in her general store, she has the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

Señora Liz asks for this loan to buy a larger amount of products in order to supply her store with drinks, cookies, juices, and sodas, etc. This will help her to realize her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, cookies, juices, sodas, etc. to be able to supply her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 48-year-old married woman from Moalboal, Cebu. She has been engaged in tricycle transport service with her husband for more than 9 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts and gasoline. A loan will help them improve the working condition of their motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts and gasoline.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Esther, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 40 years old, is married and has three children. Esther has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Esther isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Esther will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore, save more money.

Using this loan, Esther's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Monicah. She is married and living with her husband and their two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 to benefit from training courses on enterprise management.

She is a dairy and poultry farmer. She also operates a shop selling household items such as cutlery. She has applied for a loan to add more stock of cutlery to help meet customers’ rising needs. She looks forward to improved productivity, and thus, an increase in income. This will help improve her living standards, such as with better health and quality education.

Monicah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cutlery for resale and add more income for her family

loans.name: Lucía Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucía de 48 años de edad, solo estudió hasta bachillerato, no siguió con sus estudios por motivos de ingresos económicos de sus padres. Está casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales solo dos dependen de ella y el otro ya trabaja, su esposo se dedica a prestar servicio de seguridad en el instituto de la ciudad.


Lucía no tiene ningún negocio, pero trabaja en una zapatería donde venden todo tipo de calzado, ha trabajado por mas de diez años en este lugar, a través de los años ha ido aprendiendo el trabajo y gracias a su dedicación se ha ganado la confianza de sus jefes, ella trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde.


Ella necesita el crédito para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, y así sus hijos estén en un lugar seguro.

Su sueño es darles estudios a sus hijos, y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
Lucia is 48 years old. She completed high school and could not continue with her studies due to her parents' financial situation. 

She is married and has three children, only two are dependents and the other one is already working. Her husband earns a living providing security services for the town's institute.

Lucia does not have a business of her own, but she works at a shoe store selling all types of footwear. She's worked there for over ten years, learning through the years, and by her commitment she's earned the trust of her superiors. She works from 7 am to 5 pm.

She needs the loan for home improvements, so that her children can live in a safe place. 

Her dream is to provide for the children so they will have an education and never be in need of anything.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home, so her children can live in a safe place.

loans.name: Tunajielewa Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children a boy and a girl. One of them is still in school and the other one is still small. She has been selling tea which she serves with bites like, mandazi, chapati, halfcakes and beans for eight years now. She works from 06am to 12pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sugar, baking flour, cooking oil, beans and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group "Tunajielewa" which consist of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, cooking oil, beans and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Nannie

texts.en:
Nannie is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Moalboal, Cebu. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for the past 6 years now. 

Nannie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments among others. Nannie believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Tyrone

texts.en:
Tyrone is a 38-year-old married man and a father of three children from Moalboal, Cebu. He earns a living through his tricycle transport service. Tyrone has been in the business for more than four years now. 

Tyrone is asking to take a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, gasoline and other items. A loan will help him maintain the good working condition of his tricycle, thus augmenting his income.  

Tyrone’s future plans include the improvement of his livelihood and saving money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, gasoline and other items

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Winrose, a mother of six from Kitale, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. 

She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. Winrose is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. 

She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her birds. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES which she will use to buy additional poultry. With this loan, Winrose will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Help out an enterprising Kenyan farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She is blessed with good looking children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future. 

Nelly was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Nelly has an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. 

Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows, which produce between 10-15 liters a day; this helps her support her family. 

Nelly also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Nelly is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Nelly believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be a stepping stone toward her way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
José, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito que utilizara únicamente para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semilla para preparar la tierra y cultivar maíz y papayas, espera tener una cosecha abundante para alimentar a su familia y comercializar el resto.
Al invertir el préstamo anterior en sus cultivos José se mantiene trabajando para salir adelante con su familia y pagar sus deudas.
texts.en: José is in need of another loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pest-controls, and seeds to prepare the land and cultivate corn and papayas.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest to feed his family and sell the leftovers.   By investing in his crops with his previous loan, Jose kept working to get ahead and pay his debts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pest-controls, and seeds to prepare the land and cultivate corn and papayas.

loans.name: Pedro Paz

texts.es:
Pedro de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en los trabajos que él realiza, viven solos pues no tienen hijos.

Pedro se dedica a comprar ganado, el cual está ordeñando 5 vacas  de donde obtiene leche para hacer cuajada y su esposa la vende en los caseríos, Pedro tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por iniciativa propia, además siembra granos básicos como maíz y maicillo.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar 2 vacas de ordeño y para pagar transporte para movilizar las vacas.


Su sueño es tener mas ganado para aumentar la producción de leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Pedro is 39 years old and studied until the sixth grade. He is accompanied by his wife who helps him in his work. They live alone because they have no children.

Pedro makes a living buying cattle, including five milking cows. This is where he gets milk to curd, which his wife sells in the villages. Pedro has made a living in this activity for many years through his own initiative. He also plants basic grains such as corn and sorghum. 

Pedro needs this loan to buy two milk cows and to pay for the transport to move the cows.

His dream is to have more cows to increase the production of milk and its derivatives.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and to pay for transport to move the cows.

loans.name: Jasephine's Group

texts.en:
Jasephine is 35 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jasephine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jasephine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jasephine's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inputs for the production of beef tamales.

loans.name: Jentrix's Group

texts.en:
Jentrix, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 42 years old and a married mother of nine children. She is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Jentrix has been a farmer for six years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Jentrix wanted to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Jentrix hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights, as, even though Jentrix decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Iwan. Iwan lives in Bogor, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Iwan lives there with his wife and his children. Iwan owns a stall where he sells small snacks, drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma three years ago, and this is the third time he is asking a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because a loan from Kiva helps him a lot to improve his business and try another business opportunity.

As the business grows, Iwan is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Iwan improve his business and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Iwan is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Elvin Josue

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad, Elvin reside en compañía de su hermana y su abuelo materno, creció sin su padre y su madre le ha enseñado a seguir adelante y a pensar en asegurar su futuro.  Su educación fue a temprana edad sacrificada por la situación económica de su madre quien era la encargada de llevar el sustento al hogar, pero con el esfuerzo y dedicación logro terminar sus estudios de secundaria obteniendo un titulo de bachiller en ciencias y letras en uno de los colegios mas reconocidos por trayectoria educativa en esta ciudad.

Actualmente el joven no ha tenido la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios universitarios, ya que el trabajo fue considerado su primordial necesidad para poder apoyar a su madre en los gastos del hogar, trabaja para una empresa dedicada a brindar servicios de tecnología y operaciones a diferentes entidades bancarias, es por eso que ha decidido especializarse en el diseño de sitios web tecnológicos mediante un curso con duración de 7 meses.

Se considera una persona muy amable y atento para relacionarse con las demás personas, que la principal motivación de su diario vivir es poder desarrollarse como persona dentro de un ambiente laboral que le genere estabilidad económica a él y a su familia.

En su corta vida el joven considera que el momento mas difícil que ha enfrentado es decidir entre el trabajo y el estudio, piensa que nunca es tarde para prepararse profesionalmente y sabe que todas sus metas se cumplirán en el mejor tiempo y cuando Dios considere que es el tiempo. Se visualiza como un exitoso hombre de negocios, con la capacidad de brindar una mejor condición de vida a su familia .
texts.en:
At 24 years old, Elvin lives with his sister and maternal grandmother. He was raised without a father, and his mother taught him to carry on and think about securing his future.  At a young age, his education was sacrificed due to the economic situation of his mother, who was responsible for providing food for the home, but with great effort and dedication he was able to finish his studies and obtain a bachelors in sciences and language arts in one of the most renowned colleges in the city.  

Currently, this young man has not had the opportunity to continue his university studies, as his primary need was to work and be able to help his mother with household costs.  He works for a business that provides IT services to different banking entities, which is why he has decided to specialize in website design through a 7 month course. 

He is a very friendly person and courteous to others.  His primary motivation day to day is to be able to grow as a person in a work environment that will provide economic stability for himself and his family.  

In his short life, his most difficult moment that he has faced was deciding between work and school.  He believes it is never too late to grow professionally and knows that he will accomplish all his goals in due time, and when God considers the time to be right.  He views himself as a successful businessman, with te capacity to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to take a technical course on website design

loans.name: Xhevahire

texts.en:
Xhevahire is requesting  a loan from you; she wants to spend 30,000 Albanian Lek to buy onion seeds for planting and 20,000 Albanian Lek on the electricity arrears. Kindly note that the arrears were caused due to failure in operation of the largest electricity company in Albania; many households suffered from it and for more than seven months now they have been without electricity; some of them paid more than they had anticipated, some of them had no money to pay in a lump sum and some ‘lucky ones’ were not even required to pay their dues. 

Xhevahire has been in the agriculture/livestock activity for the past 24 years selling about 10 liters a day of raw milk to a nearby dairy farm for nine months each year. She also owns about ten dynym of agricultural land where she plants seasonal veggies such as potatoes and beans and sells them and also has apple orchards and sells the fruits.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds for planting and pay the electricity arrears.

loans.name: Reberwet Tree Nursery Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Samuel, a member of Reberwet Tree Nursery Group. He is 62 years old, married and blessed with six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him improve his knowledge in business management. 

His economic activity is potato and maize farming. He is borrowing a loan from Kiva to boost his potato farming business by buying manure and other inputs. This will increase his harvest, thus lead to an increase in income that he will use in supporting his children's education. 

Samuel is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and other farm inputs for higher productivity for more income

loans.name: Gitithia Center Small Traders Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Teresiah. She is 29 years old and a member of Gitithia Center Small Traders Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on business development. 

Teresiah does small-scale farming of dairy farming and also operates a shoe selling enterprise. She is borrowing money to boost her business by buying more stock of shoes to help meet her customers rising demand. She hopes this will improve her income and put her in a position to meet her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Teresiah is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes for resale and boost her family income

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Kone Tan Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located Hta Ni Kone Tan Village, in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and it consists of five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 19 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase high superiority feeds such as packets of shrimp  and duck foods (costing $18 for four days' feed to 100 ducks). The funding will help remaining members in repairing the duck farms. Duck raising has become a source of income booster in such villages.

Besides livestock, many of the Hta Ni Pat Kone Tan Villagers are farmers and have opened small grocery stores at their houses. As a second business, they go fishing and sell to nearby villages or to the town markets. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Hta Ni Pat Kone Tan village, known as Than, Kyaw, Tin, Win and Htain. Than (seated, in the middle) is 40 years old and is a housewife. Her husband farms on their two acres of crop farm, and she sells nipa palms together with her son. The family takes turns taking care of their ducks. 

Proximity's loan will help Than to purchase high quality feeds so that the ducks will lay well-nourished eggs. Selling more duck eggs will boost Than's small family income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Kone Tan Village Group

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one small daughter in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also works as an accountant in a cosmetics store.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to apply an accounting program for the cosmetics store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to control the store account and organize it more. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to apply an accounting program for the cosmetics store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and she lives with her only son and his family in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region. In Aida’s family, no one is employed, and the only source of income is from farming. 

Aida has a rich farm where she takes care of cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. Each from this great assortment of cattle in its turn has its part in Aida’s family income. Aida’s son sells their farm products, such as milk, a great range of dairy products, meat (mutton, pork and beef) and eggs, as well as their farm’s vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes and greens, which Aida cultivates in her farm. 

As Aida says, farming is a group effort for her, and in her family, each member has his duty to do his work properly and on time, in order to at the end of the month have profit that will cover all the minimum needs of her family.

She seeks this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, trabaja en elaborar hamacas para luego venderlas y tener ingresos económicos para dar el sustento diario a su familia, está acompañado y vive con su familia, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de algunos amigos, actualmente es su fuente de ingresos y ya tiene mucha experiencia, su ventaja es que él solo administra el negocio y la dificultad es que las ventas de hamacas son un poco lentas.
Invertirá en hilos de colores y de diferente grosor para elaborar las hamacas, tendrá mayor producción esperando tener nuevos clientes y dar un mejor servicio para recuperar la inversión con un margen de ganancias favorable y las utilizara de respaldo para el pago de su deuda.
Sus sueños es tener un negocio en el que ofrezca otro tipo de artesanías a sus clientes y así generar ingresos para tener una vida familiar digna.
texts.en:
José works in the production of hammocks to then sell them and have an economic income to give provide daily sustenance for his family.  He is accompanied and lives with his family.  He learned the trade with the help of some friends.  It is currently his source of income and he has a lot of experience.  The advantage is that he manages the business alone, and the challenge is that hammock sales are currently slow.  

He will invest in colored threads of different thicknesses to make the hammocks, and will have increased production, hoping to have new clients and offer better service to recover his investment with a favorable profit margin, which he will use to pay back his debt.  His dream is to have a business that offers  other types of artisan goods and will generate income to give his family a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in colored threads of different thicknesses to make hammocks.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a young farmer, 21 years old, who lives with his mother in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. He feels a great responsibility for providing the best living conditions for his mother. So he simultaneously works at a private company and does farming with the help of his mother. 

Now on his farm Armen has cows, calves, sheep and chickens. As he says he still lacks experience connected with farming and cattle care but his mother is always ready with advice and help about it. Armen's mother sells his farm’s milk, meat and eggs on a daily basis in the city wholesale market. 

On his plot of land Armen cultivates a perfect sort of potato which he sells to re-sellers each season. Armen has plans to enlarge his agricultural activities that is to make bigger his potato production. 

He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with the loan amount and he will buy a lot of potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Set- Kobor Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Paul; a member of Set Kobor Group in Nakuru. He is 29 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in January 2013.

Paul operates a retail kiosk  that sells household goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiH EA) which has enabled him acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand his business by adding more stock. This will attract more customers and hence more income that will be used educate his children and provide medical care and other family needs.

Paul is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fast moving goods like flour, sugar and cooking fat to meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Susan is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Susan's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Susan and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Josephine has been selling assorted cereals, e.g., dry maize and beans, to her customers. Her monthly income is KES 15,000 and she uses it to support her family. 

Josephine is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from Visionfund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of assorted cereals in bulk so that she may have enough to sell to her customers who are growing in number. 

She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and in the future, she plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted cereals in bulk so that she may have enough to sell to her customers who are growing in number.

loans.name: Raymond's Group

texts.en:
Raymond is a 50-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Raymond has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Raymond described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Raymond’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is young farmer who is  36 years old. He lives with his big family in the village of Gegharkunik region. Armen has two sons and a pretty daughter. His wife is busy with the care of their children and house and she helps Armen with his farming. Armen used to work in construction, but now his only occupation is farming. He cares for farm animals (a cow, sheep, lambs and chickens) and a plot of land. He sells milk, meat and eggs and his land’s harvest of potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, beans and greens. During the week, Armen sells this harvest at a wholesale market. He hardly manages to meet ends every month since his needs are a lot. With the coming of spring, potato cultivation is the most profitable in farming and each farmer must be ready for the active work connected with it.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will be spent on the purchase of potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Solidarias forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través de el podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por salir adelante y superar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en un nivel extremo de pobreza, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras lucha por ir mejorando sus condiciones económicas y dar de esa forma a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras, y con ello poder surtirse y tener una mejor variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Solidarias is part of the program to eliminate poverty. Through the program, each individual member's life circumstances are brought to light so that she may work to get ahead and overcome her poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who in the survey showed a poverty level of one, an extreme level of poverty. Through effort and continuous hard work and by selling fruits and vegetables she is struggling to better her financial situation. By doing so, she can provide her loved ones with everything that she has not been able to have. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to stock her business and have a greater variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids, a son and a daughter, in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works as an accountant in a computer accessories store.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop so he can use an accounting program for the computer accessories store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to control the store account and organize it better.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to be able to use an accounting program.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Michael will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also will purchase two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. Michael plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total, Michael’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 16 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: When women come together, they are powerful. Lenders! Meet Eunice, a 32-year-old farmer who has been blessed with a lovely family and lives in the village of Megun in the Eldoret area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to start self-help groups and the memory of this collective effort led her to join Tuiyoluk self-help group. For the past five years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Many women in rural areas are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a set back because Eunice has been making great profits in farming. Eldoret is one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming. It has good climate, soils, a transport system, and a market. Eunice has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. She is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Tuiyoluk self-help group is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan. She joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airport (Eldoret international Airport) will allow her transport the produce faster to an international market hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Tri. Tri lives in Bogor, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her four children (two daughters and two sons).  Tri owns a small stall where she sells small snacks and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. 

As a woman, she wanted to help her husband improve their life. A previous loan from Kiva helped her to improve her small business and increase her savings. She is brave enough to try another business opportunity because she got a loan from Kiva, and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business grows, Tri is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Tri improve her business and accordingly her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Tri is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner with her son. She will be thankful for your never-ending support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Klement

texts.en: Klement is a single guy with a drive to succeed. His family has been engaged in agricultural activity for the past 24 years. He joined them a couple years back. He is 26 and wants to buy onion and potato seeds for planting because the season has already started and he doesn’t want to be behind with the planting. He will then sell to wholesale buyers. Kindly note that his region is known for the delicious and largest products of these two items in addition to beans, dried meat and apple fruits. Klement’s family owns about 20 dynym of land where he plant potatoes, corn, onions and beans.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Lulzim

texts.en:
This is Lulzim a 35-year-old married father of two children who are five and one years old. He is seeking your financial help to stock up on inventory of quicklime; he then makes slaked lime with it and sells it. 

Lulzim has his own activity selling slaked lime but he also works for a pay of approximately $220/month in a factory that prepares hydrated lime. Up until three years ago, he worked in the nearby country of Greece. Then he found himself out of work and it was difficult to make a living so he decided to go back to his village and do something. 

While during winter time sales of his products drop considerably, from April till November construction goes well and so does the quicklime business as well.

loans.use: to stock up on quicklime to make slaked lime to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to built a tomb for his mother who passed away about a year ago.

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary; a member of Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is 23 years old and has one child. She has benefited from training in business management provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. 

She has a clothes-selling business as her economic activity. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more clothes for resale. This will help meet customers rising demand thus give her more income. She plans to use the anticipated income in supporting her family by providing for their basic needs.

Mary appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to enable her to boost her income and support her family.

loans.name: Susan Jeanette

texts.es:
Susan es una señorita muy amable y generosa, ella tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Susan por ser una persona responsable llego alcanzar la meta, ella es una persona profesional y por su preparación academia, ahora trabaja para una  oficina jurídica desde hace cinco años, de esta manera ella genera sus ingresos económicos, su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa o de  la necesidad que se le presente a su familia  
Susan  con el afán de culminar sus estudios universitarios,  ella solicita un prestamo de siete mil quetzales que le servirá para pagar el examen privado ,la impresión de su tesis y para el acto de graduación , Pues con lo que genera con su trabajo estaría pagando dicho prestamo. 
El sueño de Susan es poder conseguir el prestamo para culminar sus estudios con éxito este año.
texts.en:
Susan is a very nice and generous young woman.  She's twenty-five, single, and lives in a community in Sololá.  

Because she's a responsible person, Susan achieved her goal of becoming a professional.  With her academic knowledge, she's been earning her income by working for a law office for five years.  Her goal is to help her parents with household expenses and anything else the family might need.  

Eager to finish up her university studies, she is seeking a loan of  6000GTQ to pay for the private exam, writing her thesis, and graduation.  She'll pay the loan off with earnings from her job.  Her dream is to be able to pay off the loan and successfully finish school this year.

loans.use: to pay for the private exam and writing her thesis.

loans.name: Demis

texts.es:
La señora  Demis de  30  años de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación y se dedica la venta de abarrotería y  refrescos sus clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad, en su negocio vende refresco y jugos de caja  y bote, huevos, café azúcar y una gran variedad de productos de la canasta básica.
Doña Demis sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, huevos, café, pan, harina, aceite, etc. y surtir mas su negocio que está ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Con el apoyo del crédito pretende surtir  y mejorar su negocio y vivienda, su sueño es que en su próximo crédito mejorar mas su negocio.   

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero 2015
texts.en:
Demis, 30, is married and lives in a house with her husband.  She earns her living selling groceries and soft drinks.  Her customers prefer her because she's friendly.  She sells soft drinks, cans and boxes of juice, eggs, coffee, sugar, and a whole variety of basic need items.  

The business runs seven days.  Demis is seeking a loan to buy groceries including rice,  sugar, eggs, coffee, flour, oil, etc., to further stock up the business, which is located in her house.  

With support from the loan, Demis intends to stock and improve her business and home.  Her dream is put the next loan toward doing more improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, flour, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya estan casados tambien y son independientes, en su casa solo vive su esposa.

Bernardo, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado desde hace 10 años, decidio dedicarse a este negocio porque un amigo se dedicaba a este trabajo y le generaba buenos ingresos, fue así como el empezo también con este negocio y en los tiempos libre se dedica a sembrar en una parcela cerca de su casa.

Bernardo, invertira su credito para pagar la titularización de sus terrenos y pagar la medicion de estos.

El sueño Bernardo es seguir trabajando con ganado y tener una ganadería grande.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 67 years old and studied up to Grade 4. He is married and is the father of 3 children who are now married and independent. He lives alone with his wife in his house.

Bernardo has been working buying and selling cattle for 10 years. He decided to work in this business because a friend did this work and it generates good income. That is how he decided to start this business. In his spare time he works growing crops on a piece of land close to his house.

Bernardo will invest this loan to pay for the title to his lands and pay to have them measured. Bernardo's dream is to continue to work with cattle and have a large garden.

loans.use: to pay to register his land and pay to measure it.

texts.es:
Salome, de 28 años de edad, no estudió, porque desde pequeña tuvo que realizar oficios domésticos en casa de sus padres, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como vigilante en una institución y en época realiza trabajos agrícolas, tiene solamente una niña de 4 años de edad y vive con sus padres. 

Salome, cuando puede realiza trabajos en la agricultura para producir y diversificar sus alimentos, ya que junto a su familia siembra algunas hortalizas como tomate, chile, ejotes, entre otras.- Aprovechando que sus padres le ayudan en muchas labores.
 
El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y controladores de plagas, además de utensilios para realizar las labores con mayor efectividad, esto contribuirá a mejorar las producciones y los ingresos.

Salome, sueña con incrementar la produccion mediante una inversión que les garantize estabilidad.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero no tenia los recursos economicos para continuar con sus estudios, por esa razón se dedico a trabajos domésticos y en tiempos oportunos trabaja en la caficultura, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajos agrícolas, produciendo sus propios alimentos y para la venta, tiene 2 hijos.

El trabajo que realiza más, son los oficios domesticos, pero en tiempos de producción del café, hace actividades relacionadas con el rubro que es característico de la zona donde viven y de esta forma colabora con los ingresos de su hogar.

Milagro, necesita el crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que está en malas condiciones, por los daños ocasionados en época lluviosa, es por eso que se ve en la obligación de repararlo antes que de inicio el invierno.

Ella sueña con tener su vivienda en mejores condiciones y darle a sus hijos un lugar seguro y digno de ser habitado.
texts.en:
Milagro, 29, graduated high school. She didn't have the funds to continue with her studies, so she went to work as a housekeeper and, during the appropriate season, grows coffee.  She's married with two children.  Her husband works in agriculture, growing food for the family and to sell.  

Milagro works mostly as a housekeeper, but during coffee-production season she helps out with household expenses by doing work typical for the area where they live.

Milagro needs a loan to fix the roof on her house.  It's in bad shape from damage during the rainy season, so she needs to repair it before the start of winter.  

Her dream is to get her house in better condition and provide her children with a decent and safe place to live.

loans.use: to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en: Roselyne, a 39-year-old, is the proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and she is representing her group of 10 farmers from Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Roselyne has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.  Roselyne described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be buying solar lamps, in addition to fertilizer and maize seeds, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.  With this loan, Roselyne’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and buy a total of eight solar lamps.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his electronics workshop

loans.name: Paskalia's Group

texts.en:
Paskalia is a 50 year old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, and often described as a very experienced farmer. She is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Paskalia has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Paskalia described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Paskalia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a 33 year old divorced woman from Khan Younis city. She lives with her family in very poor conditions. Safa opened a store for women's bags and accessories. She loves her job and she would like to improve it in the future.

Safa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her store to implement an accounting system. By taking this loan, Safa will be able to manage her sales and accounts easily.

Safa appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her store to implement an accounting system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to implement an accounting program for the cosmetics store.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 1 Group

texts.en:
The Ekomefeemo 1 Group consists of four people from the same neighborhood. They sell kenkey (corn paste), fried fish, smoked fish and sauce pans. The representative for the group, Mary, is standing on the left in the picture. This is the ninth time that this group has sought financial support from ID Ghana, seeking to raise the level of their business activities.

Mary is 58 years old and married. Her children are all grown up and are living on their own. Mary lives alone in the family house.

In order to take care of her household needs, Mary has been selling smoked fish for 20 years. Wanting to reinforce her business and better respond to customers' demands, Mary is requesting a ninth loan, along with the other members of the Ekomefeemo 1 Group. All their previous loans have been repaid in full. They need a total amount of GHS 7,400 to expand their various businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fish, smoke them and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en: The person with her hand raised in the photo is Joan, a member of Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is 65 years old, married, and has eight children. She runs a kiosk where she sells foodstuffs. After receiving Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management, she has been able to improve her business. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her kiosk by increasing her stock of foodstuffs and other essential products she sells. She hopes this will satisfy her customers’ rising demand and thus earn more income, which will ensure that she continues to support her family by providing for their basic needs.  Joan is grateful to  Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to increase her stock of foodstuffs to sell and add to her family's income.

loans.name: Nezir

texts.en:
Nezir is photographed in front of his store, where he sells a variety of items used daily in most homes.

Nezir is 62 years old and a married father of five children, who wants to stock up on inventory items for his store. He has been running this activity for the past 24 years. Overall, he makes approximately $400/month from this activity and also has some other income from a rented bar café that his sons have been operating for sometime now. Since they are located in a town not far from the famous San Andon catholic church, the flow of people is above average, and this increases the sales in their bar café.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his variety store shown in the picture.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Ayawa est une femme mariée et vit à Ahadzikpota avec son mari et ses trois enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins  quotidiens  de la famille, Ayawa vend des casseroles et des marmites qu’elle expose dans son quartier. Ayawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Ayawa demande ce crédit pour lancer une commande des casseroles afin de disposer d’un stock nécessaire pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: Ayawa is 41 years of age, married and lives in Ahadzikpota with her husband and three children. In order to help provide for everyday needs of her family, Ayawa sells cooking pots and pans, displaying her wares in her neighborhood. Ayawa stocks up three times a month at the main market of Lomé. She is requesting this loan to buy cooking pans in order to maintain a good  merchandise stock to meet customer needs.

loans.use: to buy six saucepans and 15 soup pots.

loans.name: Sipora's Group

texts.en: Sipora, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers from Webuye District. She is 65 years old, married, and has six children.  Sipora likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014, and she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Sipora plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow. In total, Sipora’s Group will receive the necessary inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lamps with their portions of this loan, so the group will also receive a total of five solar lamps.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Dolorosa's Group

texts.en:
Dolorosa is a 63-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader who is often described as a very hard-working individual. She is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Dolorosa has noticed that she has learned a lot from her farming training.

Dolorosa described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light along with fertilizer and maize. Now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Dolorosa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gitithia Center Small Traders Self Help Group

texts.en:
James, the person holding the card in the photo, is 62 years old, married and a father of two children. He is a member of Gitithia Centre Small Traders Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from business management training.
James does small-scale vegetable and dairy farming. He is borrowing money to buy farm inputs such as manure. He looks forward to a bountiful harvest with better returns. He will be in a position to meet his family's needs such as food and clothing.
James is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and other farm inputs to help boost his farming income.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome is a 43-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual. She is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Salome has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Salome described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better crop this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light along with fertilizer and maize. Now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Salome’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shiners Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2014, the Shiners Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained on enterprise management and improve their livelihoods. The group is mostly involved in farming activities. The person raising her hand is Rachael. She is 28 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children. She sells second hand clothes and also engages in horticulture. She has applied for a loan to add more stock to her clothing business, so that she can sell more and meet rising customer demand. She hopes this loan will help increase her income, so she will be in a position to pay her children’s tuition fees. Rachael is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale, thus earning a profit to pay school fees.

loans.name: 95 United Self Help Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a member of 95 United Self Help Group. She is 58 years old, married and has 14 children. She lives with her husband and is a mixed farmer of kale, potatoes and dairy farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 where she has been able to learn about savings, business management and financial management which has helped her plan and improve her life.
She is borrowing money to buy manure and fertilizer to boost her vegetable farm. She is happy for the Kiva loan and hopes it will help boost the business so she'll be able to pay her children's school fees and provide them with basic needs. 
Grace is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and seed to boost her income for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a poly tank to store water and to renovate his commercial bath house business

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
La señora  Enma  de  42 años de edad, tiene casa propia vive con su esposo  en la ciudad de San  Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 06 años a su negocio de  pulpería y sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos que la visitan.
Doña  Enma  también tiene un taller de herrería es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante  y agradece a  Prisma por la oportunidad que le ha brindado, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, frijoles, huevos, café, azúcar, harina, panes, cubitos, etc. y así espera mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida gracias a los ingresos que obtenga.
Uno de sus sueños es que en su próximo crédito  mejorar mas su negocio vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
42-year-old Emma lives in her own home in the city of San Lorenzo, southern Honduras, with her husband. She has had a convenience store for six years. Her clients are primarily friends and neighbors who visit her. 

Emma also has an iron works shop. She is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead in life. She thanks Prisma for the opportunity it has given her. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, eggs, coffee, sugar, flour, bread, etc. to improve her business and her quality of life with the profits she will make. 

One of her dreams is to request a future loan to further improve her business and home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras, January 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, eggs, coffee, sugar, flour, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Betrice, who is in her early 30s is married with three children. Two of her children go to school and one is still young. She has been selling soft drinks for two years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Betrice's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy soft drinks and meet her customers' demands. She dreams of buying a plot of land and building her house.

Betrice will share this loan with her loan group, Malumbo, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Elizabeth, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 32 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Elizabeth is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Elizabeth says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Elizabeth will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is a 41-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, and often described as a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Esther has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Esther described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Esther’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Adem

texts.en:
Adem is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the previous loan which he used to pay for the cost of a truck for his transportation business. The loan has helped his family to have better living conditions.

They are living in an Ashkali community under very poor living conditions. His wife stays home and cares for the house and the children while he is still working in a primary school as a technical helper. His son is also working, collecting bottles and things that he sells for recycling. This helps to contribute to the family budget.

Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a cow and a calf. He is thinking of starting to sell milk and milk products. Adem is very happy that he has once again been given this opportunity. He hopes that, with the help of lenders, he will be able to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Mukuru Wa Karanjee Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Annah. She is 50 years old, married and living with her husband and their five children. She is a poultry farmer and also operates a shop selling foodstuffs. She has applied for a loan to add more stock of to her shop to help meet customers’ rising demands. She hopes for improved income that will enable her to ensure food security in her household. 

Annah is grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of foodstuffs such as flour and rice

loans.name: Ika Ithano Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Richard. He is 47 years old, married and living with his wife and their five children. He is a potato, dairy and maize farmer. He has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and dairy feed to improve his farm output. He hopes this will increase his income and help him cater for his family's basic needs.

Richard is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and feed to help improve his farming

loans.name: Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John. He is 59 years old and a member of Gitangu High Breeders Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development.

John does dairy farming to earn a living; a business he has done for two years. His goal in life is to expand his farming to a large scale. He is taking a loan to buy quality fodder for his dairy cows. This will improve milk production thus meet customers’ demand. John looks forward to improved income and to being in a better position to cater for his family's needs such as food.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy better quality fodder for their dairy cows and improve their family income.

loans.name: Magdalene's Group

texts.en:
Magdalene's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Magdalene, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married and has 3 children. Magdalene has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Magdalene isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Magdalene will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Magdalene's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Irine's Group

texts.en:
Irine's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Irine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married and has one child. Irine has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Irine isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming training ever since. This year, Irine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Irine's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dava

texts.en:
Dava, who has been in the agricultural /livestock activity for the past ten years, wants to add a dairy cow.

Dava currently has two pigs and twenty chickens and also owns two dynyms (2,000 square meters) of agricultural land where she plants seasonal veggies, has some fig and plum orchards and also grapevines. “We need dairy and we buy sometimes, but that is not a solution. This is why we thought of buying a cow, to have dairy all the time and to not spend money on buying milk or other dairies,” said Dava to the loan officer who interviewed her.

Together with her husband, in addition to their income from the sale of some of the products they produce themselves, they receive a pension of approximately $250/month.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow; currently they have none

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 30 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of sachet water to resell.

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.en:
Juliana, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. She is 49 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Juliana likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Juliana plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Juliana’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize

loans.name: Ardian

texts.en:
These are Ardian and Anjeza, his wife who suffers from heart disease. They are members of the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanians who live in the city of Korca. Ardian is 42 years old and has a 10-year-old child with Anjeza.  He collects scrap metal to earn a living. This is one of the most favorite activities amongst members of their community; they do very well in it. Usually they travel around with a motorcycle, locally called a "dumdum," and call out to ask whether households have old scraps at home that they could sell. People like Ardian then sell the metal to a metallurgical factory in the city of Elbasan that is currently owned by Turkish investors. Ardian has been doing this for about 14 years. 

The loan that he is requesting now will be used to pay for his wife’s medical treatment; she plans on going to Greece to get it done. They both seek your compassion in this health matter.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical treatment for a major disease

loans.name: Ashurgul

texts.en:
Ashurgul is 35 years old. She lives in Jomi region with her children and husband. She has been engaged in animal husbandry for five years. She likes her work because they get a good profit from it.

Now, Ashurgul is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of her livestock and improve her activity. But, unfortunately she does not have enough money to do it.

Their house is also very old. So, Ashurgul wants to get a good income from her activity and renovate her home. She waits for your support and goodness.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of livestock and improve her activity.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Курбонгул. Она шустрая и ответственная женщина. Курбонгул замужем и имеет детей. Она вместе семьей проживает в районе Пяндж. Курбонгул в родном районе занимается земледелием. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 15 лет. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честном нажитым трудом. 
На данный момент все сельские жители района уже закончили посев урожай, и Курбонгул не стало исключением. Она закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
This woman is named Kurbongul. She is a clever and responsible woman. Kurbongul is married and has children. She lives with her family in the region of Pyandzh. Kurbongul is engaged in agriculture in her native region. She has been involved in this activity for 15 years. She likes this work since through it she can earn an honest living.

At the moment, all the village residents of the region have finished planting their crops, and Kurbongul is no exception. She completed the planting and now she needs to prepare the land with mineral fertilizers, in order to get a rich and high-quality crop. But she does not have enough money to purchase sufficiently high-quality mineral fertilizers, and for this reason she requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and prepare the land.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Это Саида. Ей 42 лет. Она проживает в районе Чиликул вместе семьей. У нее муж, и четверо  детей. Старший сын женат. Младшие сыновья учатся в школе, старший сын помогает папе в работе. Саида работает учительницей в школе. Она в свободное время занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Этим видом деятельностью она занята более 21 лет. В работе на земле в основном помогает муж и дети. Саида имеет не большую часть земли, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая и по это причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее цель купить минеральные удобрения и вмешивать с почвой и начать сажать урожай. Саида надеется на Вашу помощь и считает, что с Вашей помощью она сможет закончить посев и на следующий сезон собрать богатый урожай.
texts.en: This is Saida. She is 42 years old and lives with her family in the Jilikul district. She has a husband and four children. Her eldest son is married and helps his father with his work, while the younger sons are in school. Saida is a schoolteacher and plants crops in her free time, which she has been doing for over 21 years. Her husband and children help her with the farming. Saida has a small plot of land where she grows various crops. She is ready to plant for the new harvest and this is why she applied for a loan. Her main goal is to buy fertilizers to mix with the soil and begin planting crops. Saida is depending on your support and hopes that she will be able to finish planting and bring in a rich harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and improve her crops

loans.name: Herbert's Group

texts.en:
Herbert is a 40-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of ten farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Herbert has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Herbert described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Herbert’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.
