loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Lucy. She is married and a mother of eight children. She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa (HiH EA) in April 2014.

Lucy does maize, beans and dairy farming. She is grateful to HiH EA for enterprise development.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase a dairy goat that will help improve on milk supply. She hopes this will satisfy her customers’ demand for goat milk and hence earn more income from her dairy enterprise. She will hence cater for her family’s needs such as food, and save for her old age.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat to help boost milk supply and thus increase her family's income.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La señora Arminda es una persona responsable, con esfuerzo llego a concluir el bachillerato en humanidades ya que su familia no contaba con los recursos suficientes para pagar sus estudios, tiene un pequeño hijo dependiente económico, es de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato junto a su pareja. Actualmente cuenta con una vivienda alquilada en la población de Tiraque y tiene junto a su pareja, terrenos donde siembran, los cuales fueron fueron heredados por parte de sus padres. Arminda también tiene ganados bovinos en su comunidad que cada cierto tiempo los vende, ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de un par de ganados (toros medianos) para generar mayores ingresos económicos que ayuden a su familia.
texts.en:
Arminda is a responsible person. She completed, with great effort, her High School (specialized in Humanities). Her family didn't have the resources to pay for her studies. 

She has a young son, who depends financially on her. Her marriage status is single, but she is in a common law marriage relationship.

In the present, she rents a home in the village of Tiraque. She and her partner have some land, inherited from their parents, that they cultivate.

Arminda also has domestic cattle in her community. She sells them every once in a while.

She now needs the loan to buy cattle (two medium size bulls) to create more income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle (two medium size bulls) to get more income to help her family.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena es originaria de Chuquisaca llego al trópico de Cochabamba con la finalidad de buscar un mejor futuro, en la actualidad vive en Entre Ríos, desde el momento que llego a este lugar se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura en principio en la parcela de sus padres y posteriormente adquirió su propio lote agrícola el cual le permitió progresar, años más tarde con esos ingresos logro adquirir su propio lote urbano pero la construcción de su vivienda aun continua porque se realiza de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago y con la finalidad de evitar que su vivienda en el futuro tenga problemas quiere terminar la construcción del techo y así mismo realizar el acabado fino de los muros para vivir más cómodamente y también con mayor seguridad ya que los escombros de la construcción son un problema constante tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is originally from Chuquisaca. She came to the tropic of Cochabamba with the purpose of seeking a better future, and she currently lives in Entre Ríos. 

Since she first arrived, she started working as a farmer on her parents' plot of land. Then she acquired her own farming lot, which allowed her to make progress. Years later, with the money she made, she managed to get her own piece of land in the city. 

Her home is still being built, because of her ability to pay. To avoid having problems with the home in the future, she wants to finish the construction of the roof and complete the refined finish of the walls to live a safer and more comfortable life, since the construction waste is a constant problem for her as much as for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her home for her family's benefit.

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, and they now live in Fuzuli region.

Previously, he took a loan from Komak and closed in time. Mehdi has been in the animal breeding business for four years. He prepares dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.) and sells in the local bazaar and to his neighbours to earn money.

Today he needs 1,300 AZN because the stall for his cows is in danger of falling. He wants to repair his stall.

Mehdi is thankful to Komak and Kiva for this help. In the future, he wants to get married and build a house.

loans.use: to repair the cows' stall and increase business, so that in the future he can get married and build a house.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Sally, 38 years of age, and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Kitale, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture. Sally is happily married and blessed with adorable children.

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.”

Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Kitale area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business.

Sally is a member of Such Four self-help group, and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru: Шарифамо 50 летняя жительница не большого городка под названием Дангара. Шарифамо замужем. У нее двое детей. Сыну 24 года, дочке 22 года. Шарифамо в течение 7 лет занимается продажей детской одежды. Она любит свою работу и надеется, что положение на рынке не повлияет на ее деятельность, и она продолжит свою работу. Экономическое положение страны сейчас оказывает больше влияние на рынок. Шарифамо не хочет терять клиентов и обращается за кредитом, чтобы привести больше товара, увеличить ассортимент одежды и привлечь больше клиентов.
texts.en: Sharifamo is a 50-year-old resident of a small town called Dangara. Sharifamo is married. She has two children. Her son is 24 years old and his daughter is 22. Over the course of seven years, Sharifamo has been selling children's clothing. She loves her work and hopes that her position in the market will not affect her activities, and she will continue her work. The economic situation in the country is now having more impact on the marketplace. Sharifamo does not want to lose customers and is requesting a loan, in order to bring more goods, to increase her assortment of clothing, and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Элмиры на сегодняшний день есть 1 корова, 1 бычок, 5 овец и 1 лошадь. На собственном земельном наделе мерою 2,50 Га, она выращивает картофель, пшеницу и ячмень. Также занимается закупкой картофеля у местного населения для перепродажи. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). Элмира намерена и дальше развивать ее бизнес, поэтому она повторно обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует направлять на дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса и хочет накопить на строительство дома для сына.
texts.en:
Elmira successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everybody who supported her financially. She currently has one cow, one steer, five sheep and one horse on her farm as well as 2.5 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes, wheat and barley. She also purchases potatoes from local residents for resale. Her monthly income is about 13,000 KGS.

Elmira intends to develop her business further, and therefore has approached Bai Tushum Bank again for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase steers and heifers to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and wants to save toward building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy additional steers and heifers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Uulbolsun

texts.ru: Уулболсун, 33 года, замужем, есть 2 детей школьников. У Уулболсун среднее образование, 13 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Уулболсун, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 0,34 ГА собственного земельного надела, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 4 лошади. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулболсун обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки двух лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Уулболсун намерена развить свой бизнес, что позволит накопить на обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Uulbolsun is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Uulbolsun has a secondary education. For 13 years, she has been involved in raising crops and livestock. Thanks to her hard work and determination, Uulbolsun currently has 0.34 hectares of her own land, where annually she grows potatoes for internal consumption and sale. Also on her homestead, she has two dairy cows and four horses. On a daily basis, she sells milk. Monthly income from the agricultural activities amounts to about 30,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Uulbolsun applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase two horses for increasing her livestock count. Uulbolsun intends to develop her business to allow her to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two horses in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Анаркан сейчас есть 4 коровы, лошадь. Она по-прежнему занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, ее деятельность приносит до 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Анаркан развить ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Anarkan successfully repaid her loan. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with financing. On her farm, Anarkan now has four cows and a horse. As usual, she is engaged with raising crops. Thanks to Anarkan's hard work, her activities bring in about 30,000 som (KGS) per month.

With the aim of further developing her business, she once again applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows for increasing her livestock count. Income from the loan will allow Anarkan to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Solai Rabbit Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
Priscilla is the name of the person raising her hand in the photograph. She is a member of the Solai Rabbit Farmers’ Self-Help Group. She is fifty years old, married and blessed with seven children. Two of her children are in secondary school, while the rest have completed school.

She is a tailor who credits the proper running of her business to the trainings on enterprise management she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. She would like to expand her business and needs a loan to add stock by purchasing textile fabric and sewing thread.

She hopes this will improve her customer base; thus increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve her family’s living standards, including providing them with quality education.

Priscilla is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to buy textile fabric and sewing thread to help satisfy her customers' needs and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Etant veuve, Abla vit à Adakpamé avec ses enfants dans la périphérie de Lomé. Abla travaille dure pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et leur permettre une vie  favorable quotidiennement. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Abla vend des charbons de bois dans sa maison pour avoir le gain nécessaire permettant de couvrir ses charges régulières. Abla s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodessewa trois fois par mois. Abla souhaite acheter des sacs de charbons pour remplacé son stock épuisé et réaliser encore plus de rentabilité.
texts.en: A widow, Abla lives in Adakpamé with her children at the edge of the city of Lomé. Abla works hard to ensure the education of her children and to offer a favorable everyday life for them. To achieve her goals, Abla sells charcoal in her house to make the profit necessary to be able to cover her regular expenses. Abla gets her supplies at the Akodessewa market three times per month. Abla wishes to buy sacks of charcoal to replace her exhausted stock and to achieve even more profitability.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business

loans.name: Julia Eliani

texts.es:
Julia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Julia espera poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 27 years old and lives with her family in the district of Nueva Arica, in a rural area that is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The primary activities that they have developed in this district are agriculture and animal husbandry.

Julia has made a living in the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, and oil, among other products, and her business is located in her home. She has more than 3 years of experience in this business with regular customers who have given her good references. The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of goods such as rice, sugar, and oil, among others, to increase the stock of her business. With this Julia hopes to be able to meet the diverse needs, requirements and tastes of customers in the area, which will generate higher revenues and will allow her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of goods such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 2 Group

texts.en:
The Ekome Feemo 2 Group is made up of four women who all live in the same neighborhood in Ghana. They are into selling cutlery sets, vegetables, foodstuffs, fish, tea, bread, noodles, jeans and ladies tops.

Lydia is the group representative. She is 40 years old, single and has three children between 12 and 20 years old. Lydia is responsible for the expenses of their household. Lydia left school at the secondary level and has been selling vegetables and other foodstuffs for five years now. She is very successful with her business, which allows her to provide for her family's needs.

She buys the vegetables and foodstuffs from the main market and sells them to customers door-to-door. She would like to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers, so she has requested this sixth loan, with the other members of Ekome Feemo 2, from the field partner.

This loan will enable them to fulfill their customers' needs and make more profit. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and foodstuffs from the main market to sell to customers door-to-door.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Nurzina

texts.ru: Нурзина, 34 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. Нурзина в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав почти в 2006 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нурзины есть 2 коровы и 6 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га растет кукуруза. Ежемесячная прибыль около 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Нурзина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurzina is 34 years old, married, and the mother of five children. As a main source of income for her family, Nurzina is involved in agriculture. Having begun in 2006, Nurzina today has on her farm two cows and six sheep. On a plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares, she grows corn. Monthly profits are about 20,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow for increasing sales of organic milk. Nurzina plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase organic milk sales.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Carolyne, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 42 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and has two children.

Carolyne is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Carolyne says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which have improved her day-to-day life significantly. Carolyne will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a divorced woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She and her children live together at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary. She is 34 years old and a single mother of three children, two of whom are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Mary is happy for her Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled her improve her skills in enterprise management, recordkeeping, and financial management.

Mary does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase certified seeds and fertilizer. She believes this will boost her harvest, thus increasing her supply to the markets. This will, in return, increase her proceeds, thus enabling her to provide for her family's needs with ease.

Mary is happy for Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm productivity and her income.

loans.name: Milicent's Group

texts.en:
Milicent is a 32-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Milicent has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming training sessions.

Milicent described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Milicent’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
Atilano tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus 03 hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive Atilano es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Atilano es la de sembrar café variedad Catimor. Es reconocido en la zona por la labor que realiza y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores del distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento del terreno cultivable. Esta inversión le permitirá asegurar una gran cosecha con un producto saludable y de calidad, por lo que podrá vender su producto a un mejor precio y además captar un número mayor de clientes lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Atilano is 36 years old, he lives in his own house built of rustic materials, alongside his wife and their three children in the district of Querocotillo, province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region of Peru's sierra norte.  The community where Atilano lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants know each other and work mainly in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Atilano earns a living sowing coffee of the Catimor variety. He is well known in the area for the work he puts in and he has very good working and personal references from the inhabitants of the district. He will use to loan to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain the cultivated land. This investment will enable him to ensure a good harvest with a healthy and good quality product, which he will be able to sell at a better price and also gain a larger number of customers. This will allow him to improve his income in a short period of time, increase his profits, and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his cultivated land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Maria de 56 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar, está casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene dos hijos que ya no viven con ella.


Maria tiene un chalet fuera de su casa, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como papel, arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, jugos y otros, además por las tardes vende pupusas, su horario de trabajo es de 3:00 PM a 7:00 PM.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería como maíz, frijoles, harina, etc. de esta forma podrá abastecer su chalet.

Su sueño es que su negocio le genere buenos ingresos y siempre mantenerlo surtido de todos los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study because she had to work from an early age. Maria is married and her husband earns a living as a bricklayer. She has two children that no longer live with her.

Maria runs a small grocery store outside her home where she sells basic products such as paper, rice, sugar, oil, soda, juice, etc. In the afternoons she also sells stuffed corn tortillas ("pupusas"). Her work schedule is from 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm. Maria needs a loan to purchase merchandise such as corn, beans, flour, etc. in order to restock her small grocery store. Her dream is for her business to yield a good income and to be able to keep it stocked with the products her customers need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as corn, beans, flour, etc. in order to restock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Tchilalo est une femme mariée qui habite à Agoè avec ses deux enfants dont elle prend minutieusement soin. Pour leur permettre une bonne vie éducative, Tchilalo vend des pagnes avec lesquels elle parcoure les marchés et les quartiers pour trouver sa clientèle. Tchilalo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour acheter des pagnes de diverses marques, Tchilalo nécessite de prêt pour financer sa commande  et réaliser son gain pour l’épanouissement de sa famille
texts.en: 35 years old, Tchilalo is a married woman living in Agoè with her two children, whom she takes care of meticulously. To ensure a good educational life for them, Tchilalo sells traditional clothing while walking around the markets and neighborhoods looking for her clientele. Tchilalo gets her supplies once a month at the large market in Lomé city. To buy diverse prints of traditional cloth, Tchilalo requires a loan to finance her order and to make a profit so that her family can flourish.

loans.use: to buy 32 pieces of traditional cloth.

loans.name: Bridgit's Group

texts.en:
Bridgit is a 32-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Bridgit has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming training sessions.

Bridgit described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Bridgit’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
While James comes across as a boss, you might not guess that his real passion is his farm. He loves his animals, farm fields and trees. His biggest complaint is that he is spending so much on cooking fuel that it is inhibiting his ability to expand his farm and put into practice some of the unique farming ideas he has. 

With a biogas system, he is looking forward to having clean, free cooking fuel and dedicate the money saved to implementing new initiatives on his farm that will improve productivity and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to get a biogas system to save money on cooking fuel and have a smoke-free house

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre,  El posee una tienda donde vende  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche, sopas, embutidos, gaseosas, entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos a precios realmente accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Miguel is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his mother. He owns a store where he sells basic products such as rice, beans, milk, soup, cold cuts, and soda, among others. Lately, he has seen an increase in customers because of his affordable prices. His earnings enable him to get by. Miguel is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy merchandise wholesale and in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, soup, cold cuts, and soda, among other products.

loans.name: Jeremías 33:3 Group

texts.es: La economía actual que enfrenta el país disminuye las posibilidades que los comerciantes inviertan más capital a sus negocios, debido a que las ganancias las ocupan para el sustento de sus familias, con tal situación surge un grupo llamado “Jeremías 33:3”, compuesto por tres mujeres que quieren demostrar que son capaces de incrementar sus negocios apoyadas con la institución, se unen con el objetivo de incrementar un financiamiento para capitalizar y fortalecer sus negocios y de esta manera cumplir sus metas, el cual es guiar a sus familias y darles todo lo necesario. Ellas se encuentran organizadas y dirigidas por la coordinadora del grupo quien es Yadira, una señora que goza con la experiencia que solo la vida otorga, ya que a sus 63 años es propietaria de un  taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace diez años y vende en el departamento de Masaya, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de entre tela, dacron, elástico, conos de hilo, cola de ratón, etc. Ella fue elegida para llenar de valores y disciplina a las otras integrantes del grupo que son, Reina de 42 años que dedica su tiempo al negocio de vender ropa en su comunidad y María de 44 años de edad quien ha dado a su negocio veinte años de su vida ganando mucha experiencia en la venta de verduras en las calles de Granada, este grupo lleno de experiencia busca como cerrar sus metas con una sola visión, triunfar y recibir los frutos de su negocio.
texts.en:
The current economic climate in Nicaragua has resulted in a decreasing number of opportunities for traders to invest more in their businesses as their profits must be used to support their families. 

Given this situation, the members – three women – of “Jeremías 33:3” loan group have come together and want to show that they are capable of expanding their businesses with the support of ADIM. The members have united with the aim of raising a loan to finance and strengthen their business and, as a result, achieve their goals of helping their families and providing them with what they need.

The group’s coordinator is Yadira, a woman who has life experience. At 63 years old, she has owned a dressmaking workshop in her home for a ten years; she sells her products in the Masaya department of the country. 

Yadira will use this loan to buy material, Dacron, elastic, cable ties, thread, and other items. Yadira was chosen as group coordinator in order to bring to others her values and discipline.

The other members of the group are 42-year-old Reina, who sells clothes in her community, and 44-year-old María, who has gained a lot of experience spending 20 years of her life selling vegetables in the streets of Granada.

With lots of experience, this group is looking for ways to achieve their goals together, and to triumph and enjoy the benefits that their businesses will bring them.

loans.use: to buy material, Dacron, elastic, cable ties, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimore. Cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento del terreno cultivable. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Avelino is 62 years old. He lives in his own home built of rustic materials, together with his wife, in the distruct of Pucará which is situated in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca in Peru's sierra norte. The community where he lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants mainly work in agriculture and the rearing of animals.

Avelino works in agriculture, especially growing the catimore variety of coffee. He has experience in this sector and very good personal and working references in the local area. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertlizers to maintain the cultivated land. This investment will give him profits to improve his economic situation and thus invest in better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertlizers to maintain his cultivated land.

loans.name: Santos Arely

texts.es:
Santos de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su marido trabaja realizando viajes en un pick up trasladando estudiantes que viven en su cantón hasta la escuela donde estudian, y con él tiene una hija de 8 meses de edad.

Actualmente, Santos tiene un negocio de una tienda en su casa, dicho negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años el cual surgió porque en el lugar donde viven no existían tiendas, su marido se encarga de ir a comprar los productos para ponerlos a la venta.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas productos y surtir su tienda.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio mas grande, para lo cual el préstamo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Santos is 27 years old, she studied until the 6th grade, she is married and they have an eight month old daughter. Her husband works making journeys in a pick up transporting students from where they live in his local area to the school where they study.

Currently, Santos has a shop in her house, she has had this business for several years, and began because there weren't any shops where they lived. Her husband goes to buy the products so they can put them on sale.

She needs the loan to buy more products and stock her shop.

Her dream is to have a larger business, for which the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy more products and stock her shop.

loans.name: María Reina

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por  falta de recursos económicos, actualmente es madre soltera que lucha por criar a sus hijos los cuales dependen de ella y se encuentran estudiando.


María se dedica a trabajar la tierra, el cual aprendió desde pequeña por sus padres, y ha sido su medio de subsistencia, sus hijos son quienes se involucran en el trabajo que ella realiza.


Ella necesita el crédito para pagar el arriendo donde cultiva, también comprará abono.

Su  sueño es vivir en buenas condiciones y tener mas ganancias en la venta de productos  de cultivo.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and could not go to school as her family did not have enough money to pay for it. María is a single mother who is working hard to raise her children, who are in education and dependent on her.

María earns a living working the land, a trade that she learned from a young age from her parents. This work has supported María. María’s children want to be involved in her work.

María needs this loan in order to pay rent on the land where she grows crops and to buy manure.

María’s goal is to live in good conditions and to earn higher profits when she sells her crops.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land where she grows crops and to buy manure.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 50, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a business making and selling bakery items, such as rusks, bread and biscuits. She has been doing this for many years and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Farzana has become famous for providing good-tasting bakery items. Currently, she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, and salt, along with packs of oil. She is hopeful that she will able to generate more income though her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, and salt, along with packs of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete his Bachelor of Law Degree

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат любящая, верная жена и заботливая мама. Муж Саломат как и многие мужчины сел и деревней находиться на заработах в чужой стране. У Саломат есть сыночек, которому 1,5 годика. Для нее ее сын является самым дорогим подарком Господа и ради него она готова на все. Пока ее муж заграницей Саломат с сыном живут одни. Она занимается животноводством и растениеводством параллельно. Сегодня уже пока сажать новый урожай и Саломат активно готовиться к предстоящему событию. Но у нее не достаточно средств, чтобы купить качественные семена овощей, минеральные удобрения и горючего для трактора. Без этих средств она не сможет закончить посев и получить урожай на следующий сезон. Она верит, что ей помогут и заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Salomat is a loving, devoted wife and caring mom. Her husband, like many other men in the villages, works in a foreign country. Salomat has a little son, one and a half years old. She thinks her son is the most precious gift from the Lord and she is ready to do anything for him. While her husband is abroad, Salomat and her son live alone. She both raises livestock and plants crops. It is now time to plant new crops and she is actively preparing for the upcoming event. However, she does not have enough money to buy high-quality vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and fuel for the tractor. Without these things she will not be able to finish planting for the harvest next season. She trusts that she will be helped and is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and tractor fuel.

loans.name: Sé Valiente Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Sé Valiente tiene sus orígenes con tres mujeres emprendedoras que tomaron la decisión hace cinco ciclo para conseguir un financiamiento crediticio en ADIM para incrementar el capital de sus negocios, lo coordina es Doña Gladys una señora de 41 años que vende frutas en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de papaya, banano, melón, naranjas dulces, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado surtir de productos su negocio esto la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos en ADIM. El resto de las integrantes son, Francisca una joven de 21 años pero con visión de comerciante ella vende ropa desde hace dos años, y Jeanneth que tiene dos años de vender frutas en el mercado del departamento de Masaya. Estas tres mujeres solo buscan la oportunidad de sobresalir de la situación económica por la que pasa cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The "Sé Valiente" communal bank has it's origins with 3 enterprising women who made the decision 5 loan cycles ago to get a loan from ADIM to increase the capital of their businesses.

The coordinator is Gladys, a 41 year old woman who sells fruit in the market in Masaya. The loan she is requesting is to buy papaya, bananas, melon, oranges, etc. With her previous loans she managed to stock her business with products and this has motivated her to continue seeking loans from ADIM.

The rest of the members are Francisca a 21 year old youth who has a businessperson's vision and who has been selling clothing for 2 years and Jeanneth who has been selling fruit in a market in the department of Masaya for two years. These 3 women are looking for the opportunity to excel in the economic situation that each one finds themselves in.

loans.use: to buy papaya, bananas, melon, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the safety of her home by changing the door and paying the labor, without this loan she wouldn't get this done and she needs better security.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, a 47-year-old married woman, is a vigorous lady who, for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Nasreen has requested a loan of 55000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in various colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and anticipates a boost in her earnings.

Nasreen plans to use part of her profits for the betterment of family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in various colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Koudama

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Koudama est une femme veuve qui vit avec son enfant à Kofiikpanou. Koudama achète des poissons pour les fumer afin de les revendre à ses potentiels clients et au marché. Pour disposer ses poissons, Koudama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. C’est pour financer sa nouvelle commande des paniers de poissons que Koudama demande ce crédit afin de réaliser plus de rentabilité et assurer  l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: 50 years old, Koudama is a widow, who lives with her child in Kofiikpanou. Koudama buys fish that she smokes and sells to her potential clients and at the market. To prepare her fish, Koudama resupplies twice a month at the main market in Lomé. Koudama requests this loan to finance her new order of fish in order to achieve higher profitability and to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 5 baskets of fish and 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman with two children, both of whom are under her care and still attend school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Anjeline operates a clothing business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. Her major challenge is the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With this loan of 40,000 KES that she is requesting, Angeline wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, por la facilidad de pago y atención que recibe de la institución se  decidió por un crédito nuevo con el que comprara  maíz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, agua, jugos, etc., de esa manera la tienda permanecerá surtida para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Para Sara el apoyo que ha recibido de los inversionistas kiva ha sido de mucho beneficio para que su negocio sea más rentable  y que su familia tenga un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Sara--due to the organizational support received and ease of repayment--decided to request a new loan to buy corn, beans, sugar, oil, water, juice, etc. in order to keep her store stocked and meet her customer's needs. The support that Sara has received from Kiva's investors has helped her business to become more profitable and enabled her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, oil, water, juice, etc. in order to keep her store stocked and meet her customer's needs.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has successfully built her business of cloth selling with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers. Known in her town for providing good quality fabric, she has a good client list. 

Naseem has received previous several loans from Kashf Foundation and has now requested another for 60,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase more varieties of good quality fabric to increase her sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase more good quality fabric to increase her sales

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella solicita un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios y esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Heidi tengo 18 años de edad y soy estudiante de medicina. Soy de San Pedro de Macorís, vivo en Miramar desde que nací. Somos tres hermanos de los cuales soy la única hembra y la menor de todos. No estoy casada ni tengo hijos, mi padre es chofer y mecánico y mi madre es comediante.
Estudio en la Universidad Central del Este (UCE) donde estoy cursando la carrera de medicina, tengo muchos deseos de ser doctora. Actualmente estoy cursando el segundo semestre y ya he dado materias como: Análisis Matemático, orientación Universitaria, Ingles Básico, Química General, entre otras.
Quiero tener la oportunidad de terminar mi carrera ya que es una meta que me he propuesto para seguir avanzando en el desarrollo de mi futuro. En caso de no calificar a este préstamo no tendré la oportunidad de seguir en mi carrera y eso cambiaria mi vida completamente.
Si califico este préstamo ayudaría al bienestar mío y de mis padres. Tengo como meta llegar a ser una buena doctora, salir adelante, ser un orgullo para mis padres y la sociedad, crecer como persona y ser una gran profesional.
Al terminar me gustaría poder ejercer mi profesión dándole un trato especializado a todas las personas sin distinción. Me encantaría especializarme en el área de Gineco- Obstetricia en el Hospital  Dr. Dario Contreras.
texts.en:
Heidi is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan to pay for her education. Her story is as follows:

My name is Heidi and I am an 18-year-old medical student. I am originally from San Pedro de Macorís but have lived in Miramar since I was born. I am single, childless, and the youngest and only girl of three siblings. My father is a driver and a mechanic; my mother is a comedian. I am enrolled at the Universidad Central del Este (UCE) Medical School and am very eager to become a physician. As of my second term, I have taken courses such as Mathematical Analysis, University Orientation, Basic English, and General Chemistry. 

I would like to have the opportunity to finish my degree. It is a goal that I have set for myself to get ahead and invest in my future. If I do not receive this loan, I will not be able to continue my studies, which would change my life completely. Receiving this loan will help me improve my well-being and that of my parents.

My goal is to be a good physician, to get ahead, to make my parents and the community proud, to grow as a person, and to be a great professional. After finishing, I would like to practice my profession so as to give personalized and non-discriminatory treatment to all. I would love to specialize in obstetrics and gynecology at the Dr. Dario Contreras Hospital.

loans.use: to pay for her university education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some renovations to the place seen in the picture so that he can rent it out

loans.name: Julio Pedro

texts.es:
Julio es un joven ecuatoriano de 27 años de edad, nació en Latacunga, de la provincia de Cotopaxi en un sector rural de la ciudad llamado Pastocalle vive junto a sus padres en casa propia , desde hace algún tiempo atrás. Terminó sus estudios primarios con mucha dedicación y sacrificio, Julio tuvo un espíritu luchador y al no poder ya contar con el apoyo de sus padres para continuar con sus estudios decidió trabajar desde muy joven y es así que desde muy chico se dedicó a la crianza de cerdos, para lo cual solicita un crédito el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de mas cerdos , con este trabajo  le ayudara a salir adelante día tras día. Viene de una familia muy humilde y luchadora en donde sobresalen los valores. 
Actualmente  se dedica a criar y vender animales menores como cerdos sus ventas las realiza en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad y provincia , desde muy temprano sale de su muy humilde hogar y pasa más de 8 horas diarias trabajando, aparte de esto hace ayuda a sus padres en su negocio Julio ha demostrado ser  un ejemplo de lucha continua.
Julio y su familia  hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Julio is a 27-year-old Ecuadorian man who was born in Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi, in a rural sector of the city of Pastocalle. He has lived with his parents in his own house for some time. He finished his primary school studies with great dedication and sacrifice. Julio had a fighting spirit and when he was unable to count on the support of his parents in order to continue his studies he decided to work from a very young age, so since he was a little boy he has been raising pigs. For this reason he is asking for a loan which he will invest in buying more pigs. With his job this will help him to get by day to day. He comes from a very humble and hard-working family, in which values are of utmost importance.  

He currently raises and sells young animals such as pigs. He makes his sales in the different shows around the city and province. He leaves his humble home very early and spends 8 hours working every day. As well as this, he helps his parents with their business. Julio has proved to be an example of continual hard work. 

Julio and his family pass on their cordial and effusive thanks to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making the growth of their professional and personal lives possible. With the money that they are loaned they will be able to achieve one of their greatest dreams.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Eunice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Eunice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Eunice's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cos- efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa. 
Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.
Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar una fritadora e insumos para su producción de alimentos.
Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Dora is a knowledgeable woman, who is wise and has a great deal of patience.

She is the mother of one child and has worked practically her entire life to get ahead.

She has a small stall where she sells snacks, candy, and soft drinks. In addition to this, she sells food that she herself cooks at home. 

She works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. to have her products ready and fresh for her customers, the majority of whom are residents of the area where she lives.

She wants to invest in her business and have a huge stock of ingredients and products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of beverages and snacks. Moreover, she wants to purchase a deep fryer and ingredients for her food production.

One of her main difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business, but she trusts in the help of the Interactuar corporation and in the good heart of Kiva lenders to keep her business going.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of beverages and snacks. Additionally, she wants to purchase a deep fryer and supplies for her food production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer, and to pay rent for his land.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 35-year-old married woman in the animal sales business. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Nasreen needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years with the support of her son, who is also shown in the photo. Zahida is very skilled in the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operating her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en:
Sadiqa is a 47-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sadiqa makes enough to provide for her family.

To fully restock her store, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates, thus making her stock available to her customers. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Sadiqa wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Ameh

texts.fr: Divorcée, Ameh est une femme de 47 ans qui vit avec ses enfants à Ahadzikpota dans le quartier de Lomé. Ameh vend des perles avec lesquelles elle parcoure tout le quartier et ses environs pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients. Ameh s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour acheter une quantité importante de perles, Ameh demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif et tirer une rentabilité pour son épargne.
texts.en: Ameh is a 47-year old divorced woman living with her children in the Ahadzikpota neighborhood of Lomé. She sells pearls as a street vendor all over her neighborhood and nearby areas in  response to customer demand. Ameh stocks up twice a month at the main market of Lomé. In order to buy a large quantity of pearls. Ameh is requesting this loan so as to be able to meet this goal, making a good profit margin and bolstering her savings.

loans.use: to buy 15 packs of pearls.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 28-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family.

Razia is a mother of six children. She is responsible for their food, health and education, and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her husband’s business.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more sacks of fruits like apples, mangoes and guavas, etc. This will help her husband to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of fruits like apples, mangoes and guavas, etc.

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is a 47-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to help with running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 30,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings.  She wishes to spend it on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business.

loans.name: La Quinta Estación Group

texts.es: Las comunidades más alejadas de las ciudades provocan que a veces sean las más olvidadas, pero es esos lugares donde se encuentran personas con altos valores en la sociedad porque crecen con la humildad y con las ganas de luchar, con esas energía se conformó hace tres ciclos el grupo solidario llamado “La Quinta Estación” integrado por tres socios, liderado por Alejandro un hombre nacido y criado en esas comunidades, a sus 61 años es una persona que sabe que el trabajo es la única que forma a un verdadero hambre, el compra cerdos, los destaza y comercializa en su domicilio la carne y los derivado de tal especie, esta actividad la realiza desde hace cuatro años y cuenta con la ayuda de su compañera de vida, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de un cerdo y plátanos verde, con los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado mantener su negocio.  Los otros integrantes son, María quien a su corta edad de 20 años empieza su vida de comerciante con un año de experiencia en la comercialización de ropa interior y cosméticos en su comunidad, y Erminia una señora de 50 años de edad que vende gaseosas, hielo y pan principalmente a trabajadores de las haciendas cañaleras de la comunidad desde hace tres años. Grupo como este demuestran que el trabajo es duro pero gratificante, pues así ayudan a los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
The communities that are the furthest away from towns sometimes are the ones that are most forgotten, but it is in those places where the most honorable people are found. They believe in humility and are willing to work hard. It is with this energy that the group La Quinta Estación was formed three loan cycles ago.
There are three members in the group led by 61-year old Alejandro, a man who was born and raised in the area. He is the type of person who knows that work is the only thing that satisfies true hunger. Alejandro buys and butchers pigs, and then sells the pork and pork products from his home. It’s a job he’s had for four years. His wife helps him with the work.

He is seeking a loan to buy a pig and green bananas. With the previous loans he managed to build up his business.

The other group members are as follows:
Although she is young, 20-year old María is beginning her life as a businesswoman with a year of experience selling underwear and cosmetics in her community.
50-year old Erminia has been selling soft drinks, ice, and bread mainly to the workers in the nearby sugarcane fields for three years. 

A group like this shows that although the work is hard, it is gratifying because in this way the members can help pay for family expenses.

loans.use: buy a pig and green bananas

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a married woman and has two children, both of which attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Edinah has operated a clothes selling business, and sells at the market to the town dwellers and her neighbours. 

She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith is 39 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Edith has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Edith also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Edith's Group will be able to receive a total of twelve solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kulbubu

texts.ru: Кулбубу 61 год, замужем, мать 7 детей. У Кулбубу среднее образование, сейчас она на пенсии и занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Кулбубу есть 4,0 ГА земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Также есть коровы, 2 лошади и 30 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Кулбубу составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Кулбубу планирует удвоить свою прибыль и накопить на постройку нового сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kulbubu is 61 years old, married and a mother of 7 children. Kulbubu has a secondary education. She is currently retired and involved in farming and animal husbandry. Today Kulbubu's farm contains 4.0 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale. She also has cows, 2 horses and 30 sheep. Kulbubu's combined monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 dairy cows in order to increase her milk sales. Kulbubu plans to double her profit and save money to build a new barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Jacinta's Group

texts.en:
This season is not the first one that Jacinta is working alongside One Acre Fund. She has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2011 and, although she is the only person featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Jacinta is often described by her community as a very hard-working individual and decided to be the one to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. Like many of her fellow farmers, Jacinta decided she wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

This loan will not only help Jacinta but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old and has 8 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Gladys is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Gladys started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Gladys’ Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Nalulwe's Group

texts.en:
Nalulwe is 57 years old and has 10 children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Nalulwe is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Nalulwe started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Nalulwe’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is 62 years old and has 11 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rael has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rael also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rael's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Syeda Naseem

texts.en:
Syeda Naseem always wanted the children in her community to have access to a good education. Five years ago she decided to open a school. Today, there are almost 100 students in the school. 

She feels her school has the potential to grow and needs help to build more rooms so that she can enroll more students. 

For this, she needs a loan of 110,000 PKR.

She is a good manager and believes she can expand her school and invest in the quality of education she provides.

loans.use: to buy materials to build more rooms so that she can enroll more students

loans.name: Runyararo Group

texts.en:
Runyararo Group is made up of two ladies, Judith and Chipo, who are taking their fourth loan. The two reside in Dzivarasekwa Extension, where they operate their businesses.

Judith is self-motivated and is driven by the desire to see change in her own life. She is a widowed lady with four children and is aged 50. She took her first loan from Thrive Microfinance when she was only selling chickens in her neighbourhood, restocking from farmers. She was not able to stock more than a hundred birds at a time, but from the time she received training and a loan from Thrive, she has managed to stock one hundred fifty birds at a time. She took advantage of the trainings she received, such that she boosted her business and with her profits she opened a canteen at the shopping centre.

With a loan of $1,000, Judith wants to stock even more birds, as her market has expanded. She also wants to purchase more equipment and food items for her canteen.

With her profits, she hopes to purchase a motor vehicle of her own so that travelling for the sake of business will be made easier, especially transporting her chickens from one place to another, since she does not do the rearing herself.

loans.use: to expand both her poultry and catering businesses.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita lives with her husband and sons. She sells candies in the street. She buys candies in a Mexico City market and sells them outside of her house. She has been selling in the same place for many years, and clients already know her and come back to buy more products. Margarita is asking for a loan to make some home improvements. Her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband with the family expenses and sending her kids to school. Her goal is to be able to have a comfortable retirement.

loans.use: To make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Kushanda Ishungu Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Kushanda Ishungu group, which means "Work is Passion" in their local language. Elizabeth is a single mother with four children, two going to school, and she is in the poultry business. She does not have any other sources of income to pay school fees for her children and for household consumption besides profits from her business.

Elizabeth and her friend friends joined Thrive in July 2014 and she said they are appreciative for the business advice they received. Elizabeth and her other group members got a combined loan of $1,150 United States dollars, and she used her portion of the loan amount to increase her number of chickens from 100 per batch to 200 per batch.

She also said that her business has improved and this time they have applied for a combined loan of 2,000 dollars, and she will use her proportion of the loan amount to increase the number of chickens per batch. When asked about her future plans, Elizabeth said that she has a long term plan of becoming a reliable chicken supplier for large supermarkets and restaurants.

loans.use: to expand her chicken run to get economies of scale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Irene. She is married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to acquire business management skills.

She is a dairy farmer and a vegetable farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan so as to buy dairy feeds to help improve on milk productivity. She looks forward to more income that will cater to her family's needs such as food.

Irene is happy for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds to improve her livestock for increased family income

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida always wanted to educate the children of her community and decided to open her own school after completing her education. In the school's first year, she had 70 students. Today, there are over 200 students in her school. 

Shahida feels her school has the potential to grow and needs help to build more rooms and buy furniture for her students. She requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to accomplish her goals. Shahida is an efficient school manager and focuses on providing an inclusive learning environment for her students and teachers.

loans.use: to build more rooms and buy more furniture for her students.

loans.name: Tashia Group

texts.en:
Nyarai is a member of the Tashia Women’s group. She is a married mother of four. Nyarai is in the business of producing peanut butter to sell. She started her business in 2000. The major challenge that she faced was the lack of space to operate freely, as her business requires higher levels of hygiene. She also had no machinery to produce enough peanut butter to meet her customers’ needs. 

Nyarai and her group members have been receiving financial assistance from Thrive since January 2013. She now operates from a well-spaced shop, and has three peanut butter making machines. Nyarai is now able to produce at least 100 liters of peanut butter per week. She is now a constant supplier to the surrounding shops and schools. She notes that the reason her business has grown so much is because of the lessons she received from Thrive. Nyarai now knows how to budget, save, and make daily records of all her business transactions. Now that she is getting her fourth loan from Thrive, she hopes to buy a motor vehicle for more efficiency.

loans.use: to make her peanut butter making business more efficient by buying a vehicle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
This is Joyce; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the trainings on enterprise development and financial management in order to enhance her business and improve livelihood. 

She is 46 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She lives with her family.

Her economic activity is dairy and vegetable farming. 

She is borrowing money to buy animal feed and manure to help improve her farm output. 

She looks forward to increasing her income so that she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and manure to help improve dairy and vegetable productivity

loans.name: St Francis Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady in the red dress in the photo is Jane, a member of St. Francis Self Help Group. She is 42 years old, married and a mother of five children. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has helped her realize her strength and now she has engaged in a full time business of dairy farming and kales and carrots.

Jane has requested to borrow a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to boost her vegetable farming. She looks forward to an improved harvest which will earn her more profit. She will thus be in a position to cater for her family's basic needs.

Jane is happy for Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable farming and to improve her family income.

loans.name: Vekil

texts.en:
Vekil lives with his wife and two children in Fuzuli region, but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. He has been in the animal breeding business for many years. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them to the butcher at the local bazaar to earn money. 

Today he needs a loan in the amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy little calves to increase his business, so he has applied to Komak company for aid. Vekil says he is thankful to Kiva organization and all lenders for the help. In the future he wants to help his children in education.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase business, and in the future he wants to help to his children in education.

loans.name: Ildirim

texts.en: Ildirim is 39 years old, married and has a son who is in school. His wife is a housewife and is pregnant. They are live in the Fizuli region and for 22 years have been IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fizuli city. Ildirim has a store where he sells vegetables and fruits and wants to increase his business. For this reason he needs a loan of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to expand his store's area. Ildirim is very thankful to the Kiva organization and its lenders for help. He is looking forward to becoming a father for the second time.

loans.use: to increase his store area.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 65 years old and from the county of Nakuru. He started a grovet shop with the income he got whereby he also sells animal medicines and he still operates his chemistry.  He will use the requested loan to buy more stock of animal medicines and various animal vaccines to sell to his customers, who are mostly dairy farmers.

Eliud's monthly income right now is KES 22,000. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy more medicine to sell to his customers. He hopes for a successful future for his business and family.
