loans.use: to buy more animal medicine

loans.name: Yuly Jahaira

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Agosto.
En este lugar vive la señora Yuly, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 15 y 3 años y un bebé de 10 meses  de edad,  el mayor estudian en colegio y los otros niños están bajo el cuidado de ella.  Viven  en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Yuly con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es recorriendo el centro  de la ciudad y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días desde las8h00  hasta las 18h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene  diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace dos años y le gusta el apoyo que recibe con los créditos y los bajos intereses. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the Andrés de Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabí province (know for years as the city of the "Royal Tamarind Trees"), the members of the 4 de Agosto credit group meet every two weeks. This is where Yuly lives. She is 34 years old and a single mother to her three children, ages 15 years, 3 years, and 4 months. The oldest child is in high school and the other two are under her care. They live in her parents’ house. 

Yuly works selling all sorts of clothes, with the intention of earning more of her own money and being able to get ahead at home. The way she sells is by going through the downtown area and also selling in a small shop she has in her house.  She works every day from 8am to 6pm. She sells her clothes on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise every two weeks or every month, depending on what she needs.  She has been working in this same job for ten years and it is going well for her. 

This loan will help her purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been in the 4 de Agosto credit group for two years and she likes the support she receives from the loans and the low interest. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married with two children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still young for school. She lives at rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, with her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family’s basic needs. With the loan of 40,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe de 66 años de edad, estudió solo primer grado en la escuela, actualmente está casado y su esposa tiene una tienda y un molino en su misma casa de habitación, tiene dos hijos, el varón ya no vive en casa y la hembra que si.


Felipe se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y al pastoreo de ganado bovino, labores que realiza desde hace muchos años el cual aprendió de su padre, Felipe recorre casi 300 metros hasta donde tiene sus cultivos y sus animales, trabaja de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm de lunes a sábado y el resto del día se dedica a labores del hogar.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes y también pagará mano de obra.

Lo que mas desea Felipe es que sus hijos tomen todo lo bueno que él les ha enseñado y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
66-year old Felipe has only a grade one education. He is married and his wife runs a store and mill in their home. He has two children, a son who has left home, and a daughter who still lives with them.

Felipe earns his living growing maize, beans and raising cattle. He’s been a farmer for many years; it’s a job he learned from his father. His farm is about 300 metres from his home. He works from 6 am to 1 pm, Monday to Saturday. The rest of the day he uses to work on household chores.

Felipe needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizer and to pay workers. 

His greatest wish is that his children profit from all the good things he has taught them and are good people.

loans.use: buy compost and fertilizer and pay workers

loans.name: Belliah

texts.en:
Belliah is married woman with four children all whom attends school . She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan of 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 38 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Гулнара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, более 10 лет назад начала заниматься разведением скота. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Гулнара имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 25,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Gulnara is 38 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. To provide the primary income for her family, Gulnara became involved in fattening up livestock over 10 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, Gulnara now has 3 cows. Her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS). Upon concluding that her business is profitable, Gulnara requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls in order to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and completing her house construction.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening up and resale in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Evarlyne's Group

texts.en:
Evarlyne, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group, because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Evarlyne will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Evarlyne plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Evarlyne’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by thirteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Alice also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of thirteen solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives in Bogor, which is located about a two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Lia owns a small stall where she sells small snacks, drinks, groceries and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this would be her second loan from Kiva. She wanted to help her husband improve their life. A previous loan from Kiva helped her to improve her small business and she thanks all of the lenders. 

As the business grows, Lia is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. This loan will be very useful to help Lia improve her business and her community, which needs access to such services. Lia is pictured sitting in her own small stall. She is thankful for your continuing support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of a group called Truth and they are beginning their eighth loan cycle with ID Ghana. 

The group is made up of six members and they are into the sale of sachet water, soap, bread, fruits, beads, aluminum pots, coal pots, Shea butter, slippers, maize, and groundnut. 

The loan that they will take will benefit their small businesses, including Joana. She says that she joined ID Ghana five years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Joana has managed a business for 10 years now. 

The loan she will take out is to increase capital by buying more margarine, flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread and sell to customers at retail. 

This work allows her to generate income for her family since she is married and has one dependent child. 

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Joana said she likes the training, the savings, and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy more margarine, flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread and sell to customers at retail

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en:
Loveness, a member of Light group is a married mother of three children. She sells footwear and kitchenware from Tanzania, Zambia, and Mozambique. She has been in the same business for the past 24 years, selling at Mbare Retail where products are mostly sold at wholesale price. Her business has been growing fairly well over the past few years. She is currently working towards opening her own shop specializing in footwear for ladies, men, and children in Harare Central Business District. She helps her husband to cover family expenses as he is unemployed.

As the chairperson of the group, she has helped her other four mates to better manage their small businesses of cross border trading. They have also managed to help each other build houses through their savings. These ladies reside in Crowborough Suburb of Harare. 

Loveness hopes that a loan amounting $500 from Kiva will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to expand her range of clothes, shoes, and household goods for sale

loans.name: United Women Community Group

texts.en:
The person wearing a pink top in the photo is Priscilla. She is a 29 years old and a member of United Women Community Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from trainings on enterprise development, boost their enterprises and improve their living standards.

She does vegetable and dairy farming as her main business. She needs a loan to buy animal feed, fertilizers, and manure to help boost her farming output.

She hopes this will help improve her income thus ensuring food security in her household.

Priscilla is grateful to Kiva for the great help.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer, and manure to boost her farming entreprise leading to more income for her family

loans.name: Karori

texts.en:
Karori is a very hard working and honest client dealing in the coffee trade. He is located in Kagarama, Ndekye Rubirizi district. He strategically located. He is married with five children aged 14, 12, 10, 7 and 5, all of whom go to school. He works for ten hours a day and has another source of income which is boda boda or a motorcycle taxi business. He started the coffee trade in 1999 and the reason was to sustain his family and earn an income as a man. 

This is Karori's fourth cycle and he is borrowing UGX 1,000,000 to buy more coffee to sell through his business as these months are the coffee season. All categories of people both local and urban are his clients since he buys from the local population and sells the coffee to factories in and around Ishaka and Bushenyi. He hopes to buy a bigger car to transport his coffee from his local area to the coffee factories in the urban centers. His main challenge is coffee wilt disease, that has affected all coffee farmers in the area.  He asks UGAFODE to set up a branch in Bunyaruguru since it is a bit far from Ishaka where UGAFODE is located

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, who appears in the photo, is 34 years old, married and blessed with one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.
Dickson runs an outpatient clinic where he offers medical services to the community. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to earn a living from the enterprise while providing the community with affordable health care. He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more medicine to enhance service to his customers. This will improve his income and enable him to educate his children and provide for his family's needs. 
He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: To buy medicine for the clinic leading to better income for his entreprise

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Ее зовут Мохира. Ей 26 лет. Мохира добрая и верующая девушка. Она замужем. Мохира дома занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Для нее это очень хороший бизнес, потому что она может одновременно принимать заказы на шитье и присматривать за маленькими детьми. Мохира хочет купить новую швейную машинку, потому что ее старая машинка в не исправном состоянии. Благодаря кредиту она сможет приобрести современную машинку и сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en: Her name is Mohira. She is 26 years old. Mohira is a kind and religious young woman. She is married. Mohira provides seamstress services at home. This is a very good business for her because she can concurrently accept sewing orders and watch after small children. Mohira wants to purchase a new sewing machine because her old one does not work. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and retain her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in order to retain her income source

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and pay the fees for doctor's appointments.

loans.name: Nael

texts.es: Nael de 42 años de edad se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos por mayor para su comercialización y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nael is 42 years of age and has made a living for 4 years selling basic grains (maize and beans). He sells his products in the various markets that are close to his house. With what he makes from his business, he manages to meet some of his household expenses. 

He is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy more products at wholesale so that he can sell them. In this way, he will be able to earn a better income and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains (maize and beans) at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como ama de casa,la socia es una mujer emprendedora ya que ella quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is still dedicated to being a homemaker. She is an enterprising woman who wants to provide for her family. She is applying for a loan to buy sound equipment for her house.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her house.

loans.name: Dúo Jerusalén De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jerusalén de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por doña Elvia, ella tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de regalos, cosméticos y ropa de temporada así como objetos escolares como mochilas, útiles escolares, y venta de comida y tortillas en su domicilio, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de regalos para la temporada y compra de maiz para su tortilleria, su propósito es surtir su miscelánea y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, y sobre todo seguir creciendo en el área de su economía para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, Compra de productos de libreria para la venta.
texts.en: The "Jerusalén de San Bartolo Este" duo was started by Elvia, who is 46 years old and has a business selling gifts, cosmetics and seasonal clothing, as well as school supplies such as backpacks and utensils. She also sells food out of her home. Elvia is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of gifts for the season and to buy corn for her tortilleria. Her purpose is to stock the various items in order to satisfy the needs and preferences of her customers; and above all to continue growing her business in order to support the needs of her household. She will purchase bookstore items to sell and corn for her tortilleria.

loans.use: to buy bookstore items and corn for her tortilleria

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 54-year-old married woman, from village Badiauri. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and son, who is a daily worker and does not have a stable income. Manana's husband also works on private orders and does artisan activities. For lack of financial support, Manana was unable to get high education and that's one of the reason why she couldn't find a stable job. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Manana is engaged in cattle breeding. Manana sells the milk products among her neighbors and gets small income. She wants to expand her trading business and sell products door to door in nearby villages. For this reason she requires a transport and requested a loan for it's purchase. After several unsuccessful attempts, Manana applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Manana will purchase a car and with the help of her husband, will expand her trading area as well as increase her family's income. 

This hard-working woman highly appreciates Kiva lenders' help, as her income will significantly increase because of them.

loans.use: To purchase a car and expand her trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is a married woman living with her husband and two children. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sell coconuts and paraffin. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Meet Susan, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Eldoret area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment. Susan, 35, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. 
,
She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Susan is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. 

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereal. Kenya's Eldoret area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Susan could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Susan, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Susan believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. 

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Susan to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Cosme Vinicio

texts.es:
Al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha se encuentra el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, el mismo es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de las maravillosas cascadas y hosterías en las que se pueden pasar un buen momento en familia o con amigos 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Cosme un hombre luchador de 45 años él es soltero tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad he independiente, él se dedica a la producción de ganado para carne aprendió de este negocio en su niñez junto con sus padres a este negocio le dedica un promedio diario de 8 horas, se encarga de forma personal no tiene quien le ayude, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio para pagar la limpieza que se hace cada año en la finca 
Con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos ya que podrá tener en mejores condiciones su ganado, el señor Cosme agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
In the north-west of the province of Pichincha is the district of San Miguel de los Bancos, a place of love which has a warm humid climate and is full of friendly, hard-working people. It is frequently visited by national and international tourists who come to enjoy the marvellous waterfalls and inns where they can have a good time with their family or friends. This is where Cosme lives and has his business. 

Cosme is a strong 45-year-old man who is single and has a child who is an adult and is independent. He farms cattle for meat, a trade which he learned as a child alongside his parents. He dedicates an average of 8 hours a day to this business and does the work himself without anyone to help. He is asking for a loan to invest in the business in order to pay for the cleaning that is done every year on the farm. 

With this new investment he hopes to improve his economic income as he will be able to keep his cattle in better conditions. Cosme thanks the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunities offered.

loans.use: to invest in his business and to pay for the annual cleaning of the farm

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es:
Atilio, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no tiene hijos.

Atilio, trabaja de mecánico en un taller automotriz desde hace 3 años reparando bicicletas, motos y todo lo relacionado a la mecánica.- Además de esta actividad se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles y hortalizas, todo lo hace junto a su hermano, su horario de trabajo en el taller es de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 2:00 de la tarde, el resto lo de tiempo trabaja en los cultivos. 
 
Atilio, utilizara el préstamo para compra 5 llantas, 10 neumáticos, 3 botes de pintura y algunas herramientas necesarias para su trabajo, de esta manera se le hará más fácil y podrá darle mejor atención a sus clientes.

Atilio, sueña con ampliar más su negocio y comprar más repuestos y herramientas.
texts.en:
Atilio is 33 years old. He studied up to fourth grade. He has a domestic partner who works in household chores. He does not have children. Atilio works as a mechanic at a car shop where he repairs bicycles, motorcycles and everything related to mechanic. Besides this job, he works growing basic grains such as corn and beans. He does all this with his brother. His job schedule at the car shop is from 7:00 in the morning to 2:00 in the afternoon. The rest of the day he works in his crops. 
Atilio will use the loan to buy 5 wheels, 10 tires, 3 cans of paint and some needed tools for his job. This way it will be easier to work and he will be able to give better service to his customers. Atilio dreams of growing his business and of buying more spare parts and tools.

loans.use: to buy 5 wheels, 10 tires, 3 cans of paint and some needed tools for his job.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre muy dedicado al trabajo agrícola y muy responsable, lastimosamente solo estudió hasta cuarto grado y no siguió por falta de recursos económicos. Actualmente, está acompañado y vive con su pareja, su padre y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad. Su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus hijos le ayudan a producir granos básicos como maíz, frijol, maicillo y caña de azúcar.

Victorino, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde que tenia 12 años de edad, cuando su padre lo llevaba a la milpa para enseñarle el trabajo.- Ademas, hoy en día quiere producir caña de azúcar, para elaborar el famoso atado de dulce, que puede sustituir a la azúcar procesada.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a don Victorino, para comprar una vaca.

Victorino, quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos y poco a poco ir diversificando su producción.
texts.en:
Victorino, 48 years old, is a man who is very dedicated to agricultural work and is very responsible. Unfortunately he only studied until the fourth grade and did not continue due to a lack of economic resources. He is now married and lives with his wife, his father, and their two children, ages five and eight. His wife does household work and his children help him produce bulk grains like corn, beans, sorghum, and sugar cane.

Victorino has planted corn, beans, and sorghum since he was 12 years old, when his father took him to the cornfield to teach him the work. In addition, today he wants to produce sugar cane to make the famous sugar cane honey that can substitute processed sugar. 

With the loan you will be helping don Victorino buy a cow.

Victorino wants to continue producing bulk grains and little by little diversify his production.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies, such as cement and bricks, to build an additional room in the house.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Agus. Agus lives in Cibubur, located about one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. He owns a stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the third time he is asking a loan from Kiva. He feels grateful, because the previous loan from Kiva helped him to purchase a bluetooth printer, which assists him to provide mobile payment services to his community. He thanks all of the lenders because of it.

As the business grows, Agus is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. For this time, he will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agus improves his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Agus is the one who is standing. He will be thankful for your never-ending support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Bridgit's Group

texts.en:
Bridgit is 38 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. Bridgit has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Bridgit also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Bridgit's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en:
Dorothy is 52 years old and has 11 children. She is the leader of a group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Dorothy has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Dorothy also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money.

Obtaining this loan means that Dorothy's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sumarti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sumarti. 

Sumarti lives in Cibubur, located about 1 hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. 

Sumarti owns a small stall where she provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the third time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. 

As a woman, she wanted to help her husband improve their family's life. A previous loan from Kiva helped her to improve her small business and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business grows, Sumarti is hoping to get an additional working capital loan from Kiva. 

She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. 

Your loan will be very useful to help Sumarti improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Sumarti is standing in front of Ruma's banner. 

She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène est une femme mariée très créative. Elle est âgée de 44 ans et vit à Cacaveli avec trois enfants à sa charge. Philomène prépare une pommade appelée Cristal de menthe qu’elle vend dans les rues de son quartier et au marché. Philomène s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour   commander ses matières de fabrications, Philomène demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir un bénéfice pour implanter son commerce dans les autres régions de la ville.
texts.en: Philomène is a married woman who is very creative. She is 44 years old and lives in Cacaveli, with three children in her care. Philomène makes a pommade called "Cristal de Menthe," which she sells in the streets of her neighborhood and at the market. Philomène stocks up four times a month at the major market in Lomé. To order the materials needed to make the product, Philomène is asking for a loan to finance her purchase and to have the profit to set up her business in other regions of the city.

loans.use: to purchase 1 kg of mint.

loans.name: Nobigabel

texts.en:
Nozia is a young woman working in food processing in Lascahobas. She graduated in cooking and was trained in food processing at the National Association of Fruit Processing or ANATRAF “Association Nationale des Tranformateurs de Fruits”. She also attended training in food processing and entrepreneurial leadership in France in 2011. 

Nozia is the leader of Nobigabel, a rural organization launched in 1994 to enhance the agricultural sector. She saw that much of the fruit was being wasted, and so wanted to figure out a way to conserve it.She processed them and put them in plastic plates for sale. 

Nozia has recently opened a bakery to offer more pastries in food processing.Now, she is seeking a second loan from ZAFÈN to purchase plates for better product visibility and raw materials to increase production capacity of the organization bakery. This will allow the business to create 3 new part-time jobs to sell bread in the Lascahobas area.

loans.use: To purchase plates and raw materials to increase production capacity of the organization bakery

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe 2 Group

texts.en:
Group member Beatrice belongs to this group called Yehowa Akwe 2 (God intervention). They are people who are hard working and have businesses selling wigs, silver products, plastic tables and chairs, and smoked fish. 

Beatrice is 35-years-old and lives with her husband and two children. She sells different types of wigs to her customers. She is taking her time with the business which is going well thanks to the determination she puts in each day. Beatrice wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. 

Beatrice is asking for this loan in order to buy different types of wigs for her business. She is very grateful for the loan offered and is committed to making the repayments as do other members of this group.

Together with other members of the group, Beatrice is requesting for a total loan amount of 7,400 GHS.  All the members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of wigs for her business

loans.name: Soft Group

texts.en:
Kudzanayi is the leader of the Soft group, which is based in Glen Norah A, a suburb of Harare. Kudzanayi is an agent selling Forever Living health and beauty products. She has been in this business for a year. Kudzanayi is a married mother of two school-age children. Kudzanayi and her group members heard about the empowering work of Thrive Microfinance and joined earlier this year. 

The Soft group attended lessons on group formation, record-keeping, business assessment, etc. Kudzanayi and her group members acknowledge that the lessons were an eye-opener for them in their businesses and they are now looking forward to better management of their small enterprises. Kudzanayi's husband is a self-employed film editor who has no permanent job. Kudzanayi is compelled to work hard to help him meet the needs of their children. With her current loan from Thrive, Kudzanayi is looking forward to ordering more boxes of health and beauty products to grow her profit levels.

loans.use: To expand her range of health goods for sale.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Janira is one of the members in her group, La Buena Nueva (Good New) 1, 3 & 5, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic Ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like bread, clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses.

Janira lives together with her long-term partner and her child. She is running a bakery where she sells bread. She started her business around nine years ago. She has been investing every loan to increase her sales and to buy different gadgets. This is her 17th loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, but she has made it possible to sell bread to her community and to others nearby. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for the bakery like flour, yeast, butter, salt and other products.

Janira is hoping to make her dreams come true, to have a successful business and to provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, yeast and other products for the bakery.

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es: Roxana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la reparación de fotografías y venta de marcos para fotos, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia  tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de papel fotográfico, tinta, madera, pintura, clavos, barniz, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Roxana is 33 years old, she lives with her family. For 9 years she has been selling pictures frames and repairing photographs.  She has many costumers. She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale photo paper, ink, wood, paint, varnish, and clove, to be able to work and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale photo paper, ink, wood, paint, varnish, and clove.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años (cultiva maíz), cuando ya esta su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, el joven es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young man face is pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in an area of elevated risk. He has made a living working in agriculture for several years planting corn. When it's harvest time he stores grain in silos shown in the photograph, and with the sales he reconciles domestic expenses. He is a responsible young man, honest and hard-working. He lives with his wife in their own home. He is requesting a loan to buy more supplies like: fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc...His current earnings are not enough to cover these costs but this way he'll be able to have greater revenue and better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more supplies like: fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc..

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина проживает в городке Конибодом. Конибодом отличается от других мест Таджикистана своей природой, народом и их культурой. Заррина замужем и растет двоих детей. Муж работает строителем, в том числе делает ремонты в квартирах. Заррина работает в ателье, она портниха. Ателье находиться далеко от ее дома и Заррине тяжело каждый день добираться от дома до работы и обратно. Она решила купить машину, чтобы чтобы облегчить себе дорогу. Заррина давно хотела иметь себе машину и когда она узнала, что Хумо поддерживает женщин клиентов и может ей помочь сразу обратилась за кредитом. Часть денег Заррина имеет и она обратилась за другой частью денег. Она очень хочет купить себе машину и надеется, что вы ей поможете.
texts.en: Zarrina lives in the town of Konibodom. Konibodom stands out from other places in Tajikistan due to its nature, people and culture. Zarrina is married and raising two children. Her husband is a construction worker and also does residential repairs. Zarrina is a seamstress and works at a atelier. The atelier is located far away from her house, making it difficult for Zarrina to commute from home to work and back. She decided to purchase a car to ease her commute. Zarrina has been wanting to have a car for a long time and upon learning that Humo supports women clients and can help her, she requested a loan. Zarrina has some of the money and requested a loan for the remainder. She really wants to buy a car and hopes that you will help her.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to commute to work

loans.name: Villa Manantiales Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA MANANTIALES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca ella es viuda y tiene 53 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de gallinas y cuyes, la socia las gallinas y cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas y cuyes y alimentos para los animales.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “VILLA MANANTIALES” communal bank group.  This bank is located in Cusco district, which is in Cusco province and Cusco department.

Francisca is a widow and is 53 years old and has 5 children. She works in a business raising chickens and guinea pigs. She fattens and raises the chickens and guinea pigs and later sells them in different markets. She has had this business for some years and it is going well. Her dream is to have a retail space where she can sell her chickens and guinea pigs. She asks for the loan to purchase chickens and guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

The inset photo had their picture taken after the meeting because  they had requested permission to miss the meeting for reasons relating to their work.

The other members work in a business selling animals, clothing sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

She is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Manna

texts.es:
Manna, mantiene su venta de pupusas y la tienda generando ingresos para cubrir todos sus compromisos, ella dice que es gracias a la buena inversión del crédito anterior.
Necesita de más capital para comprar harina, jugos, tomates, aderezos, aceite, boquitas, detergentes, gas propano, etc., para atender las nuevas demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manna continues to sell pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and her store is generating income to cover all of her financial commitments. She says that it is thanks to good investments with her last loan. 

She needs more capital to buy flour, juice, tomatoes, dressings, oil, snacks, detergent, propane gas, etc. so that she can attend to the new demands of her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase flour, juice, tomatoes, dressings, oil, snacks, detergent, propane gas, etc. to attend to the new demands of her clientele

loans.name: 040301260001 . 26 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to sell. Hoa is 38 years old and she is married with two children.

Hoa is the group leader of the 040301260001. 26 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Saparbu

texts.ru: Сапарбу, 60 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Супруг и внуки активно помогают по хозяйству. У Сапарбу на сегодняшний день есть 5 коров, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,80 ГА, она выращивает фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход Сапарбу составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от бизнеса помогут Сапарбу развить бизнес и накопить на покупку земельного участка для полеводства.
texts.en: Saparbu is 60 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Her husband and grandchildren actively help with the business. Today Saparbu has 5 cows and 1.80 hectares of owned land, where she grows beans and clover for the farm use. Saparbu's monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the business will help Saparbu to develop her business and save money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
These two ladies are part of the group called Promise and the group consists of two women. Both members are in their 40s and have two children. They both live in Teshie, one of the neighborhoods of Accra, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties. Group members are small retail merchants dealing in the sale of food items such as yams, onions, cooking oil, eggs and soft drinks. 

To increase their inventory, the group decided to work with ID-Ghana and are in their ninth group loan cycle. Margaret has a great reputation at selling food. She intends to use her loan to buy more inventory of yams, onions, cooking oil, and eggs to sell to customers from the wholesale market. 

Margaret hopes to use this loan to achieve a good monthly profit that will be reinvested in the business. 

She aims to buy a plot of land for residential use through her relationship with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy food items (yams, onions, cooking oil, eggs) to sell to customers from the wholesale market

loans.name: Evelyn Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 23 años de edad, es empleada de la gasolinera en el lugar donde vive, actualmente está casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad.

Evelyn, desde que se unió en matrimonio con su esposo, han tratado de salir adelante y luchar por su pequeño hijo, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo han logrado tener una pequeña casa.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar cuartones, reglas de madera y cemento para reparar el techo y el piso de la casa.

A futuro sueña con tener una mini farmacia en su casa, para ayudar a su comunidad y obtener ingresos de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 23 years old, is an employee of a gas station where she lives. Currently, she is married and has a four-year-old son.

Since she married her husband, Evelyn has tried to get ahead in life and fight for her young son. With much hard work and effort, she has managed to obtain a small house. 

Her loan would be used to buy beams, wood and cement to repair the roof and floor of her home.  

A future dream of hers is to have a small pharmacy in her house in order to help the community and earn an income from this activity.

loans.use: to buy beams, wood and cement to repair her house’s roof and floor.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Miguel, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

Miguel, es un joven muy trabajador, es comerciante de ropa y perfumes, desde hace 9 años.

Miguel, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa y perfumes para su negocio.

Él sueña con tener un negocio más grande y surtido para obtener más ganancias y ahorrar para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel, 21 years old, studied through high school. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a hardworking young man, and has been selling clothes and perfume for the past 9 years. 

Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and perfume for his business.  He dreams about having a larger business and assortment of products to be able to earn more and save to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and perfume for his business.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 51 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, junto a su hermosa familia. 
José es un hombre que le encanta trabajar con la agricultura, él cultiva diversidad de verduras, pues él está muy agradecido por el primer prestamo que obtuvo, ya que con ese prestamo,  mejoro el mantenimiento  y también sus ganancias.
Pues José ahora está solicitando un segundo prestamo, que le servirá para invertir en el cultivo de cinco cuerdas de papa y también para la compra de insumos tales como semillas y fertilizantes, José manifiesta que los préstamos le han ayudado para mejorar su cultivo, porque ha incrementado su siembra y tiene todos los insumos a su alcance y los aplica a la fecha indicada. El sueño de José más adelante es obtener mejor es ampliar mas su cultivo también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José, 51, lives in a community of Sololá with his beautiful family.

He loves working in agriculture. He grows a variety of vegetables. He is very grateful for his first loan, which he used to improve the maintenance of his crops as well as his earnings.

Now, José is applying for a second loan which he will invest in planting five rows of onions as well as to buy supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer. José says that the loans have helped him to improve his crops because he has increased his amount of sowed land and he has supplies at hand, which he applies on the right dates. José's dream is to expand his crops even more and to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to plant five rows of onions and to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old and very enthusiastic about her business. For 13 years, she has ensured that quinceañeras ("sweet sixteen" celebrated at fifteen in Mexico) and brides look their best on their special day. 
Her dream is to be renowned internationally as a Mexican wedding planner. Rosa is requesting a loan of MXN 7,000 to buy materials required for decorating the venues, such as ribbons and flowers. She has learned everything from her mother and wishes to grow her business in order to provide for her mother one day. Rosa likes to help elderly people and she also would like to establish an elderly home in the future. As a result of this loan, she will be able to improve the quality of her work and expand her clients base to increase her income and make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy material for her business organizing cotillions, such as ribbons and flowers.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is 56 years old and began a real estate business three years ago, providing advice on buying, selling and administrating houses, apartments, warehouses and buildings. Her dream is to be recognized and preferred by all the customers in the region and to be the best in property advice. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to create advertising, purchase furniture for her offices, and to provide training to employees. Guadalupe is a very loyal and committed businesswoman, so customers feel confident asking her for advice. Guadalupe likes helping people and for that reason she began this business, but the most important part of her day is to see the smile of a satisfied client. This is Guadalupe's first loan with Konfío and is confident in her financial planning skills in order to make successful repayments.

loans.use: to buy office equipment such as desks, chairs and chalkboards.

loans.name: Meyebinawoè

texts.fr: Meyebinawè est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans qui vit à Agoè avec trois de ses enfants. Meyebinawè vend des pagnes et des friperies de bonnes qualités et fait de petits bénéfices pour couvrir les charges quotidiennes de sa famille. Meyebinawè s’approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé trois fois par mois. Pour vendre ses pagnes dans des milieux plus rémunérateurs et faire de profits, Meyebinawè sollicite ce crédit pour financer son activité.
texts.en: Meyebinawè is a 45 year old woman who lives in Agoè with three of her children. Meyebinawè sells colorful wax cloths (pagnes) and good-quality second-hand clothing and makes a small profit to cover the daily costs of her family. Meyebinawè stocks up at the Hédzranawoé market three times per month. To sell her cloths in more lucrative settings and to make profits, Meyebinawè is asking for this loan to finance her business.

loans.use: to purchase 60 colorful wax cloths (pagnes) and 90 sheets.

loans.name: Noreth Arcelia

texts.en: Noreth is 43 years old and lives in a small home with her husband and children. In order to provide a better quality of life for her family, she generates an additional income by selling a variety of products from catalogues to her family, friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. The best moments for Noreth are spending quality time with her family and participating in her customers' satisfaction. Noreth would like a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy new products in bulk with a discount and resell them with a system of payments in installments. This is Noreth's first loan with Konfío and she describes herself a responsible person when managing a credit. She will be very grateful if lenders support her business.

loans.use: to finance her business selling from catalogues.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en: Benny is 54 years old, married and has a son. She always has been an independent woman, looking to get ahead and have an additional income through her business. Since 2007, she has sold cosmetics, dermatological products, veterinary products and jewelry. As an active woman, Benny is always looking for ways to persevere and improve the quality of life for her family. She plans on studying a degree in sales at an online institution for three years. Each day brings a new challenge, but she is not afraid to face the difficulties she may encounter on the way in order to expand her business and ensure customer satisfaction. She is requesting a loan of MXN 20,000 to buy jewelry and dermo-cosmetic products in bulk to resell. She will be very grateful if lenders support her business and is confident in her financial planning to make repayments on her fifth loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy dermo-cosmetic products and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon equipment and to increase grocery inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, who is in her mid 60s is married and has four grown-up kids.  She also has four grand children who are still in school. She has been running a farm business where she keeps cows, goats, pigs, and poultry since 1972. She works from 7a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be one of Lilian's several loans she has taken from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the animals at her farm and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay for her grand kids school fees, loan repayments, and household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy chicks, chickens, and chicken feed.  She dreams of increasing the animals on her farm.

Lilian will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chickens, and chicken feed

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Thôn Thuận - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Hoa operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hoa is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhóm 01 - Thôn Thuận - Quảng Nham solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hoa has been involved in this business for 2 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 03.02.17 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Loan is 37 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.02.17 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 21 - Thôn Thắng - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng operates a food stall restaurant, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Hằng is 44 years old and she is married with four children.  She is the leader of a 7-member group, the Nhóm 21 - Thôn Thắng - Xã Quảng Nham Solidarity Group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: 030504090003.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en: Mrs Hiên works in agriculture raising poultry and is requesting a loan to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children. She also leads a loan group called the 030504090003.Thiệu Trung Solidarity Group, which consists of four people, and lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area of Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Hiên joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business skills and has successfully repaid three previous loans. She has been in her current line of work for more than 10 years, and one the biggest difficulties she faces is a lack of capital. Thanks to the profits she makes from her business, Hiên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 030504080003.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Nhân works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Nhân is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Nhân is the group leader of the 030504080003.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  \rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nhân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: 030501030004.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Từ works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Từ is 37 years, married, and has 2 children.  Từ is the group leader of the 030501030004 Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province..

This is Từ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Từ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Từ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Nhóm 08- Thôn Thuận -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to resell.

Phương is 23 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Phương is the group leader of the Nhóm 08- Thôn Thuận -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  Phương lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phương has been involved in this business for 2 years.  One of the most critical business difficulty that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est âgée de 51 ans et vit avec ses neuf  enfants dans le quartier de Cacaveli. Kossiwa travaille parfaitement pour venir en aide aux différents besoins de sa famille. Kossiwa vend des produits d’alimentations générales en se déplaçant dans les quartiers pour trouver un revenu pouvant couvrir leurs charges quotidiennes. Kossiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché Lomé. Pour avoir plus de revenu Kossiwa demande ce prêt pour acheter d’autres produits destinés à la vente et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 51 years old and lives with her nine children in the Cacaveli neighborhood. Kossiwa works perfectly to help out with her family's different needs. Kossiwa sells her general food products by moving around in the neighborhoods to find a revenue that can cover the costs of her daily expenses. Kossiwa stocks up four times per month in the big market in Lomé. To have more revenue, Kossiwa is asking for this loan to buy other products destined for sale and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 boxes of tomatoes and 12 packets of seasoning.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 - Thôn Tân - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Gái is 44 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Gái operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Gái has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Gái is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 - Thôn Tân - Xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of seven members. In 2012, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Gái has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Gái hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 030901080002.thiệu Dương.16 Group

texts.en: Mrs Hợp operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit for a living, and is requesting a loan to buy more produce to resell. She is 24 years old, married and the mother of one child. She also leads a group called the 030901080002.Thiệu Dương.16 Solidarity Group, which has three members.  She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2014, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business skills. She has successfully repaid two prior loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and has been in her current line of work for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. Thanks to her business profits, Hợp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to resell

loans.name: 030906110002.thiệu Dương.16 Group

texts.en: Mrs Hải operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells soup, and is requesting a loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of one child. She also leads a group known as the 030906110002.Thiệu Dương.16 Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area of Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Hải joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one prior loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and has been in her current line of work for three years. One of her biggest challenges is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to cook soup to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Thôn Tiên Thắng - Quảng Lợi Group

texts.en: Mrs Thùy earns a living by running a store where she sells cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to resell. She is 23 years old, married and the mother of one child. She also leads a five-member group, the Nhóm 05 - Thôn Tiên Thắng - Quảng Lợi Solidarity Group, and lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area of Thanh Hoa province. In 2013, Thùy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two prior loans and has been involved in her current line of work for three years. The main hardship she faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Thùy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her little house in order to live in better conditions with her family

loans.name: 030906110002.thiệu Dương.16 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quế operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Quế has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Quế is 47 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 030906110002.Thiệu Dương.16 Solidarity Group, which consists of nine members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Quế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Quế has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quế hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 031201130003.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 37 years old and is married with two children. For more than ten years, she has run a retail business where she sells cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. Hoa lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province One of Hoa’s greatest business difficulties is her lack of capital. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2010 to improve her business and has repaid four previous loans. Hoa is the group leader of the 031201130003.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to sell. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to sell

loans.name: 031701090002.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a service business, cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to maintain her hair-cutting store.

Thúy is 25 years old and she is married, with one child. She is the group leader of the 031701090002.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to make enough money to provide for her child, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to maintain her hair-cutting store.

loans.name: Ani Lizet

texts.es:
Ani, de 25 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como útiles escolares, ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, para iniciar su papelería en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido papelería al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Ani is 25 years old. She is very clear on what she wants for her life and she has decided to finish her studies to get ahead and have a good life. She wants to work as a saleswoman with a variety of merchandise like school supplies, clothing, and accessories like wallets and some cosmetics, among other items, in order to open her stationery store in the city of Puerto Boyacá. She wants to start this business with the desire to seek the resources necessary to sustain it and for her studies, and also to be able to contribute to her household expenses. She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.

She is asking for a loan to buy a wide stock of paper wholesale in order to take advantage of the opportunity to be independent presented by Corporación Interactuar. She hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and to have more stable earnings, and she is thankful to everyone who is able to contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to buy a wide stock of paper wholesale

loans.name: 030302080002.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luận is 55 years old and she is married with three children. Luận is the group leader of the 030302080002.thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Luận works in agriculture raising poultry. Luận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Luận has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Luận hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 18 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thụ is 60 years old and is married with eight children. For more than ten years, she has operated a food stall/restaurant where she sells fish. On of Thụ’s most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thụ is the group leader of the 18 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Thụ is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. With her business profit, Thụ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée très entreprenante qui vit avec ses cinq enfants dans le quartier de Cacaveli. A l’âge de 47 ans, Yawa est une commerçante de maïs et d’igname qui traverse tous les coins de son quartier pour trouver des acheteurs. Yawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Wahala. Son gain ne lui permet pas de satisfaire favorablement les besoins de son ménage. C’est pourquoi Yawa demande ce crédit pour financer ses achats et avoir la capacité de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is an enterprising married woman who lives with her five children in the Cacaveli neighborhood. At 47 years old, Yawa sells corn and yams and visits all corners of her neighborhood to find buyers. Yawa gets her supplies four times per month from the market in Wahala. Her profits don't allow her to fully meet her household expenses, which is why Yawa is asking for this loan to finance her purchases and give her the capacity to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of corn and four piles of yams.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia, a sus 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos. 
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, pues no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos y está desempleada; esto la llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, un almacén de venta de mercancía como papelería útiles escolares, entre otros; piensa laborar toda la semana en las tardes y los fines de semana durante todo el día. 

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de un surtido para su papelería, de esta manera dará inicio a su idea de negocio, aprovechando la buena ubicación del sector donde pondrá su negocio, pues es una zona muy transitada y existe la posibilidad de atraer muchos clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Libia, at 60 years of age, is a single mother of two. Due to the lack of employment opportunities, she has gone through a very difficult economic situation, since she does not have any support from her children’s father and is unemployed. This led her to seek other options to get ahead, wanting to set up her own business, a store selling stationary items such school supplies, among other things. She would like to work every weekday afternoon and all day weekends.

This is the reason that encourages her to request a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of assorted supplies for her stationary store, and in this way get her idea off the ground, taking advantage of the great location of the area where she’ll open her store, since it is a high traffic area and has the possibility to attract many potential customers.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her stationary store

loans.name: Claudia Marcela

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de salón de belleza

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerá su hija de 5 años la cual tiene con su actual matrimonio.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar unas sillas y mesas de trabajo, esmaltes, productos capilares, entre otros para iniciar.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una joven lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
